  • ### Resumen de la tabla: La tabla presenta datos relacionados con los KPI de Taxonomía para las inversiones del Grupo Allianz en el año 2024. Los encabezados incluyen "Additional, complementary disclosures: breakdown of denominator of the KPI" y "Monetary amounts (€ bn)". Los porcentajes y proporciones se desglosan de la siguiente manera: 1. El porcentaje de derivados respecto al total de activos cubiertos por el KPI es del 3.0%. 2. La proporción de exposiciones a empresas financieras y no financieras no sujetas a los Artículos 19a y 29a de la Directiva 2013/34/EU sobre el total de activos cubiertos por el KPI es del 29.2% para empresas no financieras y del 16.7% para empresas financieras. 3. La proporción de exposiciones a empresas financieras y no financieras de países fuera de la UE no sujetas a los Artículos 19a y 29a de la Directiva 2013/34/EU es del 22.8% para empresas no financieras y del 10.2% para empresas financieras. 4. La proporción de exposiciones a empresas sujetas a los Artículos 19a y 29a de la Directiva 2013/34/EU es del 9.9% para empresas no financieras y del 28.5% para empresas financieras. 5. La proporción de exposiciones a otros contrapartes y activos sobre el total de activos cubiertos por el KPI es del 12.6%. 6. La proporción de inversiones distintas de las mantenidas en contratos de seguros de vida donde el riesgo de inversión es asumido por los asegurados es del 81.4%. 7. El valor de las inversiones que financian actividades económicas no elegibles según la Taxonomía, en relación con el total de activos cubiertos por el KPI, es del 31.1% para el "Turnover" y del 30.5% para el "CAPEX". 8. El valor de las inversiones que financian actividades económicas elegibles según la Taxonomía, pero no alineadas, es del 17.8% para el "Turnover" y del 18.3% para el "CAPEX".
  • ### BEGIN TABLE La tabla presenta los requisitos de divulgación y puntos de datos relacionados, clasificados por "Materiality" y "Sub-section/sub-sub-section". Los años no están especificados en el contenido. 1. **ESRS S2-1** aborda el incumplimiento de los principios de los UNGPs sobre Empresas y Derechos Humanos y las directrices de la OCDE (párrafo 19), así como las políticas de diligencia debida relacionadas con los convenios fundamentales de la OIT (párrafo 19). Ambos son materiales y se relacionan con las políticas de ESRS y el modelo de negocio estratégico para los trabajadores en la cadena de valor. 2. **ESRS S2-4** trata temas de derechos humanos e incidentes en la cadena de valor (párrafo 36), considerado material, con enfoque en objetivos, acciones, canales para plantear preocupaciones y procesos para remediar impactos negativos. 3. **ESRS S3-1** incluye compromisos de políticas de derechos humanos (párrafo 16) y el incumplimiento de principios de UNGPs, OIT u OCDE (párrafo 17), ambos materiales y vinculados al modelo de negocio estratégico para comunidades afectadas. 4. **ESRS S3-4** aborda temas e incidentes de derechos humanos (párrafo 36), considerado material, con enfoque en objetivos, acciones, canales para plantear preocupaciones y procesos de interacción con comunidades afectadas. 5. **ESRS S4-1** sobre políticas relacionadas con consumidores y usuarios finales (párrafo 16) y el incumplimiento de principios de UNGPs y OCDE (párrafo 17) no son materiales. 6. **ESRS S4-4** aborda temas e incidentes de derechos humanos (párrafo 35), considerado material, con enfoque en acciones. 7. **ESRS G1-1** sobre la Convención de las Naciones Unidas contra la Corrupción (párrafo 10 (b)) y la protección de denunciantes (párrafo 10 (d)) no son relevantes, ya que las políticas ya están implementadas. 8. **ESRS G1-4** sobre multas por violación de leyes anticorrupción y antirrobo (párrafo 24 (a)) y estándares anticorrupción y antirrobo (párrafo 24 (b)) son materiales, con enfoque en incidentes confirmados de corrupción o soborno. 9. Se menciona la aplicación de la cláusula de salvaguarda según ESRS 2.5(e) en relación con §§ 289e y 315c HGB para la brecha salarial de género en S1-16, sin más detalles.

Les émissions de gaz à effet de serre liées à la Catégorie 15 du GHG Protocol, concernant les émissions financées, ne sont pas explicitement disponibles dans les données fournies. Cependant, il est mentionné dans le contexte que les émissions de la Catégorie 15 incluent actuellement uniquement les émissions de Scope 1 et 2 de nos entreprises investies, en raison de l'incertitude entourant les données de Scope 3 pour le portefeuille d'entreprises. Il est estimé que ces émissions financées se situent entre 87 millions et 161 millions de tonnes de CO2e. Cette large fourchette est due à la sous-déclaration actuelle des émissions de Scope 3 et aux variations significatives des estimations par les fournisseurs de données (Context Num-2).

En termes de secteurs d'activité ou de types d'actifs financés, le contexte ne fournit pas une distinction claire pour la Catégorie 15. Pour ce qui est du type de financement, les émissions financées sont calculées pour les investissements en actions cotées et obligations d'entreprises, prêts aux entreprises cotées et non cotées, financement de projets, ainsi que des fonds (Context Num-3).

Il est noté également que les émissions financées pour certaines classes d'actifs, comme les obligations sécurisées, les ABS/MBS et les liquidités, ne sont pas calculées en raison de l'absence de méthodologie disponible pour ces classes d'actifs (Context Num-3).


Afficher les sources Azure
Sources Azure :
  • over the reporting period, and may also include emissions from sub - leased spaces if under control of the sub -lessee. Downstream leased assets therefore refers to tenant emissions. Where the Allianz Group fully consolidates a real es tate investment, we allocate tenants' controlled emissions to Scope 3 category 13. Methodology Emissions are calculated using a similar approach to that described below in the section on category 15 on Directly Owned Real Estate (Not Fully Consolidated Assets) . For fully consolidated downstream leased assets, Allianz recognizes 100 % of Scope 3 GHG emissions. Category 15 – Financed emissions Financed emissions – Proprietary Investments General statement The Allianz Group calculates financed emissions for corporates, public debt, and real estate held on the balance sheet, excluding cash and securitized products (like ABS/MBS and Covered Bonds) due to the absence of relevant methodologies. Our methodologies were defined in line with the SFDR Final over the reporting period, and may also include emissions from sub - leased spaces if under control of the sub -lessee. Downstream leased assets therefore refers to tenant emissions. Where the Allianz Group fully consolidates a real es tate investment, we allocate tenants' controlled emissions to Scope 3 category 13. Methodology Emissions are calculated using a similar approach to that described below in the section on category 15 on Directly Owned Real Estate (Not Fully Consolidated Assets) . For fully consolidated downstream leased assets, Allianz recognizes 100 % of Scope 3 GHG emissions. Category 15 – Financed emissions Financed emissions – Proprietary Investments General statement The Allianz Group calculates financed emissions for corporates, public debt, and real estate held on the balance sheet, excluding cash and securitized products (like ABS/MBS and Covered Bonds) due to the absence of relevant methodologies. Our methodologies were defined in line with the SFDR Final
  • Inventory Fluctuations Working Group. To date, we do not calculate financed emissions for covered bonds, ABS/MBS, and cash as there is no methodology available for these asset classes. These asset classes are therefore part of the “no methodology” group in the table “Proprietary investments GHG emissions – split per asset class. ” We calculate three types of financed GHG emissions defined by the underlying investment: − Corporates, which includes all investees with a balance sheet, i.e., – in PCAF terminology – listed equity and corporate bonds, business loans and non- listed equity, project finance, as well as funds ; and − Real Estate, which includes real estate equity investments, commercial real estate loans, and retail mortgages, as well as funds; and − Public Debt, which includes sovereign debt, sub -sovereign debt, and supranational debt. As there is no specific PCAF guidance on carbon accounting for sub -sovereigns and supra -nationals, we Inventory Fluctuations Working Group. To date, we do not calculate financed emissions for covered bonds, ABS/MBS, and cash as there is no methodology available for these asset classes. These asset classes are therefore part of the “no methodology” group in the table “Proprietary investments GHG emissions – split per asset class. ” We calculate three types of financed GHG emissions defined by the underlying investment: − Corporates, which includes all investees with a balance sheet, i.e., – in PCAF terminology – listed equity and corporate bonds, business loans and non- listed equity, project finance, as well as funds ; and − Real Estate, which includes real estate equity investments, commercial real estate loans, and retail mortgages, as well as funds; and − Public Debt, which includes sovereign debt, sub -sovereign debt, and supranational debt. As there is no specific PCAF guidance on carbon accounting for sub -sovereigns and supra -nationals, we
  • Scope We use three methodologies for calculating financed emissions , defined by the underlying investments. The table below shows the scope per asset class. Cash, derivatives, and unit -linked products1 are excluded from our financed emissions calculation.   • shows the percentage of total book value for which financed emissi ons are available. Since there is no guidance from PCAF or other carbon accounting standards for calculating financed emissions of bonds from and loans to sub -sovereign and supranationals, the Allianz Group has adapted the methodology used for sovereigns. Methodology – Financed emissions of r eal estate Financed emissions represent the share of a real estate investment’s GHG emissions that are attributed to the Allianz Group based on the proportion of financing provided by the Allianz Group , relative to th e entity’s total value. These emissions are calculated annually. The key inputs to this metric are: − Investment value (€ Investment): − Directly Owned Real Estate Equity and Funds: Ownership share based on market value. − Commercial Real Estate Loans and Retail Mortgages:Outstanding loan amount. C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement shows the percentage of total book value for which financed emissi ons are available. Since there is no guidance from PCAF or other carbon accounting standards for calculating financed emissions of bonds from and loans to sub -sovereign and supranationals, the Allianz Group has adapted the methodology used for sovereigns. Methodology – Financed emissions of r eal estate Financed emissions represent the share of a real estate investment’s GHG emissions that are attributed to the Allianz Group based on the proportion of financing provided by the Allianz Group , relative to th e entity’s total value. These emissions are calculated annually. The key inputs to this metric are: − Investment value (€ Investment): − Directly Owned Real Estate Equity and Funds: Ownership share based on market value. − Commercial Real Estate Loans and Retail Mortgages:Outstanding loan amount. C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement

  • − The Flexible Working Metric (%), − Country -specific energy intensities values, and − Average remote working area. The energy consumption for remote working is then converted into GHG emissions (Scope 3) on the following basis: − Remote working electricity: the IEA market mix at country level. − Remote working heating/cooling: district heating/cooling factors. It should be noted that remote working -related energy is in scope of the Allianz Group GHG emissions targets and out of scope of the Allianz Group share of renewable electricity targets and energy in office buildings targets. Category 13 – Downstream leased assets This refers to the operation of assets owned by an Allianz company (lessor) and leased to other entities in the reporting year. Emissions in this category are those not included in the Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions reported by the lessor, i.e., they are emissions from the lessee over the reporting period, and may also include emissions from sub - − The Flexible Working Metric (%), − Country -specific energy intensities values, and − Average remote working area. The energy consumption for remote working is then converted into GHG emissions (Scope 3) on the following basis: − Remote working electricity: the IEA market mix at country level. − Remote working heating/cooling: district heating/cooling factors. It should be noted that remote working -related energy is in scope of the Allianz Group GHG emissions targets and out of scope of the Allianz Group share of renewable electricity targets and energy in office buildings targets. Category 13 – Downstream leased assets This refers to the operation of assets owned by an Allianz company (lessor) and leased to other entities in the reporting year. Emissions in this category are those not included in the Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions reported by the lessor, i.e., they are emissions from the lessee over the reporting period, and may also include emissions from sub -
  • Scope 2 emissions increased generally due to increased data coverage; it should be noted that for a part of the real estate portfolio without market -based data, location -based data has been used, which are typically higher. Our Scope 3 category 15 emissions currently only include Scope 1 and 2 emissions from our corporate investees. Given the uncertainty about Scope 3 data for the corporates portfolio, we estimate that these financed emissions amount to between 87 mn and 161 mn t CO 2e. This wide range is due to the current underreporting of Scope 3 emissions and significant variations in estimations by data providers. We are committed to closely monitoring this topic while further developing our reporting capability to enhance our disclosure.   • Annual Report 2024 − Allianz Group 160 Methodology Information and Additional Tables Scope 1 GHG emissions Methodology Scope 1 GHG emissions are direct GHG emissions from sources owned or controlled by the company. There are two sources of GHG emissions that are owned or controlled by the Allianz Group : − Stationary Combustion: gas and oil heating systems, back -up generators. − Mobile Combustion: company -owned or leased vehicles. We also report fugitive emissions for our real estate assets, based on refrigerant top ups over the reporting period. Scope 2 GHG emissions Introduction Scope 2 GHG emissions come from the consumption of purchased electricity, heat, or steam: − Electricity – Office buildings, real estate, and renewables assets, and data centers. − District heating and cooling – Office buildings, real estate, and renewables assets. In line with external requirements by the Greenhouse Gas Protocol for accounting for Scope 2 emissions, we use the dual reporting approach Annual Report 2024 − Allianz Group 160 Methodology Information and Additional Tables Scope 1 GHG emissions Methodology Scope 1 GHG emissions are direct GHG emissions from sources owned or controlled by the company. There are two sources of GHG emissions that are owned or controlled by the Allianz Group : − Stationary Combustion: gas and oil heating systems, back -up generators. − Mobile Combustion: company -owned or leased vehicles. We also report fugitive emissions for our real estate assets, based on refrigerant top ups over the reporting period. Scope 2 GHG emissions Introduction Scope 2 GHG emissions come from the consumption of purchased electricity, heat, or steam: − Electricity – Office buildings, real estate, and renewables assets, and data centers. − District heating and cooling – Office buildings, real estate, and renewables assets. In line with external requirements by the Greenhouse Gas Protocol for accounting for Scope 2 emissions, we use the dual reporting approach
  • purposes. However, we continue to monitor the evolution of the Taxonomy Regulation to cover further sectors of the economy and become a tool for portfolio steering in th e future. In addition, as part of the 2024 Taxonomy reporting, Allianz is required to disclose its exposure to the six nuclear and gas activities stipulated in the Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2022/ 1214 ( Annex III). This disclosure seeks to elicit the portion of aligned investments that are a result of the stated activities. For 2024, Allianz ’s exposure to nuclear and gas activities is considered very small (around 3 % of aligned assets for turnover and CAPEX based on total alignment figures). The eligible tu rnover based exposure of all other objectives beside climate change is around 2 % in 2024. Allianz took the decision to de -scope third- party asset management purposes. However, we continue to monitor the evolution of the Taxonomy Regulation to cover further sectors of the economy and become a tool for portfolio steering in th e future. In addition, as part of the 2024 Taxonomy reporting, Allianz is required to disclose its exposure to the six nuclear and gas activities stipulated in the Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2022/ 1214 ( Annex III). This disclosure seeks to elicit the portion of aligned investments that are a result of the stated activities. For 2024, Allianz ’s exposure to nuclear and gas activities is considered very small (around 3 % of aligned assets for turnover and CAPEX based on total alignment figures). The eligible tu rnover based exposure of all other objectives beside climate change is around 2 % in 2024. Allianz took the decision to de -scope third- party asset management
  • Allianz took the decision to de -scope third- party asset management from E.U. Taxonomy investment reporting, in line with current market practice and our interpretation of existing regulatory requirements for 2024 reporting. The main alignment KPIs for 2024 include alignment based on turnover and alignment based on CAPEX. For our financial investments, each KPI is determined using only reported data for the investee. If, for example, Allianz has an investment in a company with a turnover alignment of 10 % and the book value of the investment is 100, Allianz would report a turnover alignment balance of 10. If Allianz has covered assets of 200, then the final alignment share based on turnover would be 10/200, or 5 %. The total alignment based on turnover additionally includes alignment shares from Allianz ’s own investment real estate held for investment, retail mortgages and renewable investments. The total alignment KPI based on CAPEX is determined in the same way. Allianz took the decision to de -scope third- party asset management from E.U. Taxonomy investment reporting, in line with current market practice and our interpretation of existing regulatory requirements for 2024 reporting. The main alignment KPIs for 2024 include alignment based on turnover and alignment based on CAPEX. For our financial investments, each KPI is determined using only reported data for the investee. If, for example, Allianz has an investment in a company with a turnover alignment of 10 % and the book value of the investment is 100, Allianz would report a turnover alignment balance of 10. If Allianz has covered assets of 200, then the final alignment share based on turnover would be 10/200, or 5 %. The total alignment based on turnover additionally includes alignment shares from Allianz ’s own investment real estate held for investment, retail mortgages and renewable investments. The total alignment KPI based on CAPEX is determined in the same way.
E1-122 bis

Je souhaite connaître le total des émissions liées à l’activité d’assurance (insurance associated emissions).

nan

Je suis désolé, mais les informations spécifiques sur le total des émissions liées à l'activité d'assurance (insurance associated emissions) ne sont pas fournies dans les documents disponibles.


Afficher les sourcesLLM
Sources LLM :
  • Assuming a static portfolio in terms of 2024 business volume, our intensity target of 0.14 kt CO2e/mn € insurance premium would correspond to associated absolute GHG emissions of 0.63 mn t CO2e for 2030. This figure is an illustrative view rather than an accurate representation of the expected absolute emissions in the target year and will change due to our dynamic portfolio. As our portfolio grows in business volume and data coverage increases, enabling us to report on more of the portfolio, we expect the associated absolute GHG emissions to grow as well. Assuming a static portfolio in terms of 2024 business volume, our intensity target of 0.14 kt CO2e/mn € insurance premium would correspond to associated absolute GHG emissions of 0.63 mn t CO2e for 2030. This figure is an illustrative view rather than an accurate representation of the expected absolute emissions in the target year and will change due to our dynamic portfolio. As our portfolio grows in business volume and data coverage increases, enabling us to report on more of the portfolio, we expect the associated absolute GHG emissions to grow as well.
  • Le tableau présente les leviers de décarbonisation, les actions associées, ainsi que les changements réalisés et attendus dans les émissions de gaz à effet de serre (GHG) pour deux périodes : du 1er janvier au 31 décembre 2024 et du 1er janvier 2025 au 31 décembre 2029. - **Début de la période par rapport à la base de référence** : Une réduction de 3,3 MtCO2e a été réalisée en 2024. - **Motor retail – Décarbonisation des clients assurés** : Les engagements sur la transition vers le net zéro et la décarbonisation des clients ne sont pas quantifiables pour 2024 et 2025-2029. - **Motor retail – Pilotage du portefeuille** : Les solutions bas carbone ont permis une réduction de 0,5 MtCO2e en 2024, et devraient réduire les émissions de 22 à 18 MtCO2e entre 2025 et 2029. - Les changements supplémentaires dans le portefeuille ont permis une réduction de 0,1 MtCO2e en 2024, et devraient réduire les émissions de 7 à 5 MtCO2e entre 2025 et 2029. - Une autre catégorie de changements dans le portefeuille a permis une réduction de 2,8 MtCO2e en 2024, et pourrait varier entre une réduction de 1 MtCO2e et une augmentation de 1 MtCO2e entre 2025 et 2029. - **Fin de la période par rapport à la base de référence** : Une réduction totale de 6,8 MtCO2e a été réalisée en 2024, et une réduction totale attendue de 30 MtCO2e est prévue pour la période 2025-2029. and

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les leviers de décarbonisation et les actions associées, ainsi que les changements réalisés et attendus dans les émissions de gaz à effet de serre (GHG) pour deux périodes distinctes : 2024 et 2025-2029.
    - Début de la période par rapport à la base de référence : - Les engagements sur la transition vers le net zéro et la décarbonisation des clients ne sont pas quantifiables. - Les solutions bas carbone et les changements supplémentaires dans le portefeuille ont permis une réduction de 3,3 MtCO2e en 2024.
    - Fin de la période par rapport à la base de référence : - Les solutions bas carbone devraient réduire les émissions de 22 à 18 MtCO2e entre 2025 et 2029. - Les changements supplémentaires dans le portefeuille devraient réduire les émissions de 7 à 5 MtCO2e. - Une autre catégorie de changements dans le portefeuille pourrait varier entre une réduction de 1 MtCO2e et une augmentation de 1 MtCO2e. - La réduction totale attendue pour la période 2025-2029 est de 30 MtCO2e.

  • − Surety, − Engineering lines: − Construction all-risks, − Erection all-risks, − Corporate life and pensions, personal accident, − − Treaty reinsurance, and − Annual Report 2024 − Allianz Group C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement Methodology – Insurance-associated emissions We calculate IAE by determining a policyholder’s proportional GHG emissions (CO₂e) based on the share of insurance premiums they pay relative to their revenues. This calculation uses the ratio of the customer’s insurance premium to their total revenues (attribution factor) and is multiplied by their Scope 1 and 2 GHG emissions (as defined by the GHG Protocol). Scope 3 GHG emissions are excluded for now due to data reliability but may be included later. The total portfolio IAE is the sum of all insurance policies’ IAE in the portfolio. Key inputs for the IAE calculation include: Insurance premiums: Defined as Insurance Revenue, net of acquisition costs (brokerage, commissions). − Surety, − Engineering lines: − Construction all-risks, − Erection all-risks, − Corporate life and pensions, personal accident, − − Treaty reinsurance, and − Annual Report 2024 − Allianz Group C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement Methodology – Insurance-associated emissions We calculate IAE by determining a policyholder’s proportional GHG emissions (CO₂e) based on the share of insurance premiums they pay relative to their revenues. This calculation uses the ratio of the customer’s insurance premium to their total revenues (attribution factor) and is multiplied by their Scope 1 and 2 GHG emissions (as defined by the GHG Protocol). Scope 3 GHG emissions are excluded for now due to data reliability but may be included later. The total portfolio IAE is the sum of all insurance policies’ IAE in the portfolio. Key inputs for the IAE calculation include: Insurance premiums: Defined as Insurance Revenue, net of acquisition costs (brokerage, commissions).
  • ### END TABLE For the portfolio in scope of the emission reduction target for commercial insurance, the 2024 insurance associated emissions were 1.02 mn t CO2e1 and the insurance-associated emission intensity was 0.23 kt CO₂e/€ mn Insurance Premium2. The IAE for a commercial insurance policy is equal to the GHG emissions (Scope 1 and 2) from the policyholder multiplied by the attribution factor provided by PCAF (insurance premium of the policy divided by the revenue of the customer). Additionally, specific assumptions for policies covering risks of assets linked to Renewables and Low-Carbon technologies are taken to discount the IAE linked to these policies. For commercial insurance, an emission intensity reduction has been achieved in 2024 compared to the baseline, decreasing from 0.26 kt CO2e/mn € Insurance Premium in 2022 to 0.23 ktvCO2e/mn € in 2024. This marks an 11.7 % reduction from the 2022 baseline and a 6.4 % increase compared to 2023. ### END TABLE For the portfolio in scope of the emission reduction target for commercial insurance, the 2024 insurance associated emissions were 1.02 mn t CO2e1 and the insurance-associated emission intensity was 0.23 kt CO₂e/€ mn Insurance Premium2. The IAE for a commercial insurance policy is equal to the GHG emissions (Scope 1 and 2) from the policyholder multiplied by the attribution factor provided by PCAF (insurance premium of the policy divided by the revenue of the customer). Additionally, specific assumptions for policies covering risks of assets linked to Renewables and Low-Carbon technologies are taken to discount the IAE linked to these policies. For commercial insurance, an emission intensity reduction has been achieved in 2024 compared to the baseline, decreasing from 0.26 kt CO2e/mn € Insurance Premium in 2022 to 0.23 ktvCO2e/mn € in 2024. This marks an 11.7 % reduction from the 2022 baseline and a 6.4 % increase compared to 2023.
  • Subsidiaries are required to set underwriting criteria, engage with (potential) customers on GHG-emitting activities, and develop insurance offerings for low-emission and zero-emission technologies. The Allianz Energy Guidelines, also referred to in the ASIS, on Coal, Oil Sands, and Oil & Gas business models, and the related restrictions apply as defined by those Statements. For further information on the ASU, please refer to the section Allianz ESRS policies. GHG emissions of our insurance portfolio The table below provides an overview of the insurance-associated GHG emissions. The table shows data from the previous year, current emissions, and our target emissions. To calculate IAE for both commercial and motor retail insurance, we follow the PCAF standard. Annual Report 2024 − Allianz Group C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement Insurance-associated GHG emissions Subsidiaries are required to set underwriting criteria, engage with (potential) customers on GHG-emitting activities, and develop insurance offerings for low-emission and zero-emission technologies. The Allianz Energy Guidelines, also referred to in the ASIS, on Coal, Oil Sands, and Oil & Gas business models, and the related restrictions apply as defined by those Statements. For further information on the ASU, please refer to the section Allianz ESRS policies.   • Insurance-associated GHG emissions – Commercial insurance: Contribution to decarbonization per lever % (change in GHG emissions versus target baseline 2022) Insurance-associated GHG emissions – Commercial insurance: Contribution to decarbonization per lever % (change in GHG emissions versus target baseline 2022)
  • Le tableau présente les émissions de gaz à effet de serre (GES) des investissements propriétaires pour les années 2024 et 2023, réparties selon les catégories et les Scopes 1, 2 et 3. Les émissions du Scope 1, provenant des actifs réels au bilan, ont diminué de 38,4 %, passant de 28,778.8 en 2023 à 17,723.7 en 2024. Les émissions du Scope 2 basées sur la localisation ont augmenté de 23,3 %, passant de 60,179.5 en 2023 à 74,180.8 en 2024, tandis que celles basées sur le marché ont augmenté de 38,7 %, passant de 38,062.9 en 2023 à 52,804.1 en 2024. Les émissions significatives du Scope 3 ont diminué de 15,1 %, passant de 57,359,001.7 en 2023 à 48,717,427 en 2024, principalement en raison de la baisse des émissions liées aux investissements (de 57,268,098.1 en 2023 à 48,626,453.1 en 2024). Les émissions des actifs loués en aval ont légèrement augmenté de 0,1 %, passant de 90,903.6 en 2023 à 90,974.1 en 2024. Les émissions totales des investissements propriétaires basées sur la localisation ont diminué de 15 %, passant de 57,447,960.0 en 2023 à 48,809,331.7 en 2024. De même, les émissions totales des investissements propriétaires basées sur le marché ont diminué de 15 %, passant de 57,425,843.4 en 2023 à 48,787,955.1 en 2024. and

    BEGIN TABLE

    Catégorie 2024 2023 Variation en %
    Scope 1 Emissions
    Émissions de GES du Scope 1 provenant des actifs réels au bilan 17,723.7 28,778.8 (38.4)
    Scope 2 GHG Emissions
    Émissions de GES du Scope 2 basées sur la localisation provenant des actifs réels au bilan 74,180.8 60,179.5 23.3
    Émissions de GES du Scope 2 basées sur le marché provenant des actifs réels au bilan 52,804.1 38,062.9 38.7

    13 Actifs loués en aval 90,974.1 90,903.6 0.1
    15 Investissements 48,626,453.1 57,268,098.1 (15.1)
    Total des émissions de GES des investissements propriétaires (basées sur la localisation) 48,809,331.7 57,447,960.0 (15.0)
    Total des émissions de GES des investissements propriétaires (basées sur le marché) 48,787,955.1 57,425,843.4 (15.0)

    Résumé du tableau : Le tableau présente les émissions de gaz à effet de serre (GES) pour les années 2024 et 2023, réparties selon les Scopes 1, 2 et 3. Les émissions du Scope 1 ont diminué de 38,4 %, tandis que celles du Scope 2 ont augmenté, avec une hausse de 23,3 % pour les émissions basées sur la localisation et de 38,7 % pour celles basées sur le marché. Les émissions significatives du Scope 3 ont diminué de 15,1 %, principalement en raison de la baisse des émissions liées aux investissements. Les émissions totales des investissements propriétaires, qu'elles soient basées sur la localisation ou le marché, ont également diminué de 15 %.

  • Résumé du contenu du tableau : - Le tableau présente les émissions de gaz à effet de serre (GHG) au 31 décembre pour les années 2023 et 2024, réparties en trois catégories : Scope 1, Scope 2 et Scope 3. - Les émissions **Scope 1 GHG** brutes sont passées de 31,773.7 en 2023 à 36,160.9 en 2024, soit une augmentation de 13,8 %. - Les émissions **Scope 2 GHG** brutes basées sur la localisation ont augmenté de 112,227.8 en 2023 à 118,928.5 en 2024 (+6,0 %), tandis que celles basées sur le marché ont diminué de 7,929.2 à 5,947.0 (-25,0 %). - Les données pour les émissions **Scope 3 GHG** en 2023 ne sont pas disponibles pour les catégories suivantes : biens et services achetés, activités liées au carburant et à l'énergie, voyages d'affaires et déplacements des employés. - Les émissions totales des opérations propres basées sur la localisation sont passées de 240,746.5 en 2023 à 257,718.7 en 2024 (+7,0 %). - Les émissions totales des opérations propres basées sur le marché ont augmenté de 136,447.9 en 2023 à 144,737.2 en 2024 (+6,1 %). - Lorsque le **SAF** (Sustainable Aviation Fuel) est inclus, les émissions totales basées sur le marché sont passées de 136,447.9 en 2023 à 142,648.5 en 2024 (+4,5 %). and

    As of 31 December 2024 2023 Delta in %

    Total own operations GHG emissions (market-based) (SAF⁵ included) 142,648.5 136,447.9 4.5

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : - Les émissions de gaz à effet de serre (GHG) sont réparties en trois catégories : Scope 1, Scope 2 et Scope 3. - Les émissions Scope 1 ont augmenté de 13,8 % entre 2023 et 2024. - Les émissions Scope 2 basées sur la localisation ont augmenté de 6,0 %, tandis que celles basées sur le marché ont diminué de 25,0 %. - Les données pour les émissions Scope 3 incluent des catégories telles que les biens et services achetés, les activités liées au carburant et à l'énergie, les voyages d'affaires et les déplacements des employés. Cependant, les données de 2023 pour ces catégories ne sont pas disponibles. - Les émissions totales des opérations propres basées sur la localisation ont augmenté de 7,0 %, tandis que celles basées sur le marché ont augmenté de 6,1 %. Lorsque le SAF est inclus, l'augmentation est de 4,5 %.

  • Le tableau présente les thèmes de durabilité, les exigences de divulgation, les sections et les sous-sections associées. Les thèmes principaux incluent le changement climatique (E1), la pollution (E2) et les ressources en eau et marines (E3). Chaque thème est subdivisé en plusieurs sous-sections qui couvrent des aspects tels que les stratégies, les politiques, les actions, les cibles et les métriques liées à la durabilité. Pour le thème E1 – Changement climatique, les sous-sections incluent des stratégies de transition vers le net zéro, des politiques et actions de décarbonisation, des cibles de réduction des émissions de GES, et des métriques climatiques pour le groupe Allianz. Le thème E2 – Pollution aborde les politiques, actions et cibles spécifiques à la pollution. Le thème E3 – Ressources en eau et marines traite des politiques, actions et cibles liées à ces ressources. De plus, les processus d'identification et d'évaluation des impacts matériels, des risques et des opportunités sont mentionnés dans les sous-sections de matérialité (E1 – IRO-1, E2 – IRO-1, E3 – IRO-1). Les informations sont organisées par exigences de divulgation et par sections pour chaque thème. and

Il couvre principalement trois thèmes : le changement climatique (E1), la pollution (E2) et les ressources en eau et marines (E3). Chaque thème est divisé en sous-sections détaillant les stratégies, politiques, actions, cibles et métriques liées à la durabilité. Les informations incluent des processus d'identification des impacts matériels, des risques et des opportunités, ainsi que des objectifs et des actions spécifiques pour chaque domaine.

Je suis désolé, mais les documents fournis ne contiennent pas de chiffre spécifique pour le total des émissions liées à l'activité d'assurance. Les informations disponibles portent principalement sur les méthodologies et les réductions d'intensité des émissions pour certains segments, mais pas le total global des émissions associées à l'assurance.

  • - **Total GHG emissions:** The majority of emissions for an insurance company are concentrated in Scope 3, Category 15. We are constrained by the current development of methodologies and the availability of data. Consequently, we are not yet able to comprehensively cover emissions from all business activities contributing to the total business volume. - **Total GHG emissions:** The majority of emissions for an insurance company are concentrated in Scope 3, Category 15. We are constrained by the current development of methodologies and the availability of data. Consequently, we are not yet able to comprehensively cover emissions from all business activities contributing to the total business volume.

Additionally, specific assumptions for policies covering risks of assets linked to Renewables and Low-Carbon technologies are taken to discount the IAE linked to these policies. Additionally, specific assumptions for policies covering risks of assets linked to Renewables and Low-Carbon technologies are taken to discount the IAE linked to these policies. This marks an 11.7% reduction from the 2022 baseline and a 6.4% increase compared to 2023.
  • # Methodology – Insurance-associated emissions We calculate IAE by determining a policyholder’s proportional GHG emissions (CO₂e) based on the share of insurance premiums they pay relative to their revenues. This calculation uses the ratio of the customer’s insurance premium to their total revenues (attribution factor) and is multiplied by their Scope 1 and 2 GHG emissions (as defined by the GHG Protocol). Scope 3 GHG emissions are excluded for now due to data reliability but may be included later. The total portfolio IAE is the sum of all insurance policies' IAE in the portfolio. **Key inputs for the IAE calculation include:** - **Insurance premiums:** Defined as Insurance Revenue, net of acquisition costs (brokerage, commissions). - **Customer emissions:** Based on Scope 1 and 2 emissions sourced from MSCI and Refinitiv, or parent company emissions if the subsidiary data is unavailable. # Methodology – Insurance-associated emissions We calculate IAE by determining a policyholder’s proportional GHG emissions (CO₂e) based on the share of insurance premiums they pay relative to their revenues. This calculation uses the ratio of the customer’s insurance premium to their total revenues (attribution factor) and is multiplied by their Scope 1 and 2 GHG emissions (as defined by the GHG Protocol). Scope 3 GHG emissions are excluded for now due to data reliability but may be included later. The total portfolio IAE is the sum of all insurance policies' IAE in the portfolio. **Key inputs for the IAE calculation include:** - **Insurance premiums:** Defined as Insurance Revenue, net of acquisition costs (brokerage, commissions). - **Customer emissions:** Based on Scope 1 and 2 emissions sourced from MSCI and Refinitiv, or parent company emissions if the subsidiary data is unavailable.
  • ## Total GHG emissions inc. insurance (location-based) - 52,034,326.8 - 60,665,061.5 - (14.2) ## Total GHG emissions inc. insurance (location-based) - 52,034,326.8 - 60,665,061.5 - (14.2)
  • # Allianz 2030 intermediate targets: alignment with 1.5°C pathways We consider our impact on climate change to result from the GHG emissions generated from our business (Scope 1, 2 and 3 emissions). For Scope 3, category 15, our reporting boundaries are in line with GHG Protocol so that currently, assets under management owned by third parties and unit-linked funds are not part of the emissions reporting boundaries at Allianz Group. # Allianz 2030 intermediate targets: alignment with 1.5°C pathways We consider our impact on climate change to result from the GHG emissions generated from our business (Scope 1, 2 and 3 emissions). For Scope 3, category 15, our reporting boundaries are in line with GHG Protocol so that currently, assets under management owned by third parties and unit-linked funds are not part of the emissions reporting boundaries at Allianz Group.

Sources Pypdf :
  • ### GHG emissions of our insurance portfolio The table below provides an overview of the insurance-associated GHG emissions. The table shows data from the previous year, current emissions, and our target emissions. To calculate IAE for both commercial and motor retail insurance, we follow the PCAF standard. 1_Principles for Sustainable Insurance - United Nations Environment - Finance Initiative. Annual Report 2024 - Allianz Group E1 Climate Change 75
  • Assuming a static portfolio in terms of 2024 business volume, our intensity target of 0.14 kt CO2e/mn € insurance premium would correspond to associated absolute GHG emissions of 0.63 mn t CO2e for 2030. This figure is an illustrative view rather than an accurate representation of the expected absolute emissions in the target year and will change due to our dynamic portfolio. As our portfolio grows in business volume and data coverage increases, enabling us to report on more of the portfolio, we expect the associated absolute GHG emissions to grow as well.
  • ### Insurance - associated emissions - Commercial Underwriting Portfolio While we deem IAE not mandatory under E1 of the ESRS, we have developed entity-specific metrics to report these emissions, based on the methodology of PCAF1. For more information, please refer to the Explanatory Notes on the Allianz company website.
  • ### END TABLE For the portfolio in scope of the emission reduction target for commercial insurance, the 2024 insurance associated emissions were 1.02 mn t CO2e1 and the insurance-associated emission intensity was 0.23 kt CO2e/€ mn Insurance Premium2. The IAE for a commercial insurance policy is equal to the GHG emissions (Scope 1 and 2) from the policyholder multiplied by the attribution factor provided by PCAF (insurance premium of the policy divided by the revenue of the customer). Additionally, specific assumptions for policies covering risks of assets linked to Renewables and Low-Carbon technologies are taken to discount the IAE linked to these policies. For commercial insurance, an emission intensity reduction has been achieved in 2024 compared to the baseline, decreasing from 0.26 kt CO2e/mn € Insurance Premium in 2022 to 0.23 ktvCO2e/mn € in 2024. This marks an 11.7% reduction from the 2022 baseline and a 6.4% increase compared to 2023.
  • # --- Page 112 --- ## C_ Group Management Report_ Sustainability Statement ### Methodology - Insurance-associated emissions We calculate IAE by determining a policyholder's proportional GHG emissions (CO2e) based on the share of insurance premiums they pay relative to their revenues. This calculation uses the ratio of the customer's insurance premium to their total revenues (attribution factor) and is multiplied by their Scope 1 and 2 GHG emissions (as defined by the GHG Protocol). Scope 3 GHG emissions are excluded for now due to data reliability but may be included later. The total portfolio IAE is the sum of all insurance policies' IAE in the portfolio. Key inputs for the IAE calculation include: - Insurance premiums: Defined as Insurance Revenue, net of acquisition costs (brokerage, commissions). - Customer emissions: Based on Scope 1 and 2 emissions sourced from MSCI and Refinitiv, or parent company emissions if the subsidiary data is unavailable.
  • range for the magnitude of the Scope 3 of Scope 3 emissions for our proprietary investments in corporates, by assessing the actual portfolio data available and comparing this to estimated data from verified sources. We will continue to monitor developments in this area, and develop our disclosures as appropriate. Additionally, for our motor retail and commercial insurance portfolios, we have made important progress in measuring insurance-associated emissions (IAE) and have set emission reduction targets in 2023. While we deem IAE as not mandatory under E1 of the ESRS, we have developed an entity-specific metric to report these emissions, based on the methodology of the Partnership for
  • Data on insurance premiums and emissions is reported quarterly by subsidiaries, which is then used to monitor progress against plan. External reporting occurs annually and includes the current year emissions and 2022 baseline (MtCO2), coverage percentage (%), and the data quality score. Emissions are reported with a one-year lag in line with the PCAF standard, meaning 2022 emissions were calculated using 2021 data. The coverage percentage reflects the share of premiums in the baseline portfolio that are included in the emissions reduction target. It is calculated as the ratio of the total premiums for the baseline portfolio compared to the total premiums of the Motor Retail line of business. Emissions reporting is aligned with the Worldwide Harmonized Light Vehicle Test Procedure (WLTP). For vehicles with emissions values based on the older New European Driving Cycle (NEDC) standard, a conversion factor was developed by comparing WLTP and NEDC values from 2017 to 2020.
  • ### Commercial insurance For commercial insurance, our target is to reduce the insurance- associated emission intensity of the in-scope sub-portfolio by 45% by 2030 against our 2022 baseline. The target focuses on the large corporate companies insured by AGCS for which GHG emission data is available. For 2024, this cohort represented 13% of the premiums in the commercial segment for which emission accounting methodologies are currently available.
  • ### Zusammenfassung der Tabelle Die Tabelle enthält drei Spalten mit den Labels: "Disclosure Requirement", "Reference" und "Annotation". Die Zeilen umfassen Informationen über die Erfahrung der Mitglieder des Vorstands und des Aufsichtsrats, die für Sektoren, Produkte und geografische Standorte des Unternehmens relevant sind. Die erste Zeile beschreibt die Anforderungen an die Mitglieder des Vorstands gemäß dem deutschen Versicherungsaufsichtsgesetz (VAG) und der BaFin-Rundschreiben 9/2023 (VA) sowie Art. 273 der delegierten Verordnung (EU) 2015/35. Es wird betont, dass die Mitglieder des Vorstands über ausreichende theoretische und praktische Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Versicherungs- und Finanzmärkte, Geschäftsstrategie, Governance-System, Finanz- und versicherungsmathematische Analyse sowie regulatorische Anforderungen verfügen müssen. Die zweite Zeile beschreibt die Anforderungen an die Mitglieder des Aufsichtsrats gemäß dem VAG und BaFin-Rundschreiben 10/2023 (VA). Es wird hervorgehoben, dass die Mitglieder des Aufsichtsrats über ausreichende Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Rechnungswesen, versicherungsmathematische Praxis, Investmentmanagement, Prüfung und internes Modell verfügen müssen. Beide Gremien müssen ihre Eignung und Zuverlässigkeit jährlich durch Selbstbewertungen und BaFin-Bestätigungen nachweisen. Zusätzliche Informationen zu den relevanten Erfahrungen der Mitglieder sind in deren Lebensläufen auf der Allianz-Website verfügbar.
  • ### Zusammenfassung der Tabelle: Die Tabelle enthält Informationen zu den Offenlegungsanforderungen bezüglich der Zusammensetzung und Vielfalt der Mitglieder der administrativen, leitenden und überwachenden Gremien. Die Spalten sind wie folgt benannt: "Offenlegungsanforderung", "Referenz" und "Anmerkung". 1. Die Offenlegungsanforderung "Informationen über Zusammensetzung und Vielfalt der Mitglieder der administrativen, leitenden und überwachenden Gremien" verweist auf den Jahresbericht - Corporate Governance Statement - Teile "Vorstand" und "Aufsichtsrat". 2. Die Offenlegungsanforderung "Anzahl der geschäftsführenden Mitglieder" verweist auf den Jahresbericht - Corporate Governance Statement - Teil "Zusammensetzung und Arbeitsweise des Vorstands" und gibt die Zahl 9 an. 3. Die Offenlegungsanforderung "Anzahl der nicht geschäftsführenden Mitglieder" verweist auf den Jahresbericht - Corporate Governance Statement - Teil "Zusammensetzung und Arbeitsweise des Aufsichtsrats" und gibt die Zahl 12 an. 4. Die Offenlegungsanforderung "Informationen über die Vertretung von Arbeitnehmern und anderen Beschäftigten" verweist auf den Jahresbericht - Corporate Governance Statement - Teile "Zusammensetzung und Arbeitsweise des Aufsichtsrats" und "Zusammensetzung und Arbeitsweise des Vorstands". Die Anmerkung dazu beschreibt, dass der Aufsichtsrat aus zwölf Mitgliedern besteht, wobei sechs Vertreter der Aktionäre durch die Hauptversammlung und sechs Vertreter der Arbeitnehmer durch den SE-Betriebsrat ernannt werden. Der derzeitige Aufsichtsrat umfasst vier Arbeitnehmervertreter aus Deutschland (einschließlich eines Gewerkschaftsvertreters) sowie jeweils einen Vertreter aus Frankreich und Italien. Zudem wird ein Mitglied des Vorstands für den Bereich "Arbeit und Soziales" ernannt, wobei diese Ernennung der Zustimmung des Aufsichtsrats bedarf.
  • ### Zusammenfassung der Tabelle: Die Tabelle zeigt die GHG-Emissionsziele für proprietäre Investitionen und enthält die folgenden Labels: "Book value in € bn", "% of total", "Retrospective targets performance", "Milestones and target years", "Baseline year 2019 value", "Delta current year vs baseline in %", "2030 target" und "Delta target 2030 vs baseline in %". Die Jahre 2024, 2023, 2019 und 2030 werden berücksichtigt. 1. **All Corporates (Listed and Non-listed)**: Buchwert von 369,5 € Mrd. (48,2 % des Gesamtwerts). Retrospektive Zielwerte: 57,8 tCO2e/€ Mio. investiert (2024) vs. 71,2 (2023), Delta: (18,8 %). Basiswert 2019: 108,1 tCO2e/€ Mio., Delta: (46,5 %). Ziel für 2030: 54,0 tCO2e/€ Mio., Delta: (50 %). 2. **Listed Corporates (Traded Equity / Corporate Bonds)**: Buchwert von 203,4 € Mrd. (26,5 % des Gesamtwerts). Retrospektive Zielwerte: 12,3 Mio. tCO2e (2024) vs. 14,0 (2023), Delta: (12,1 %). Basiswert 2019: 24,9 Mio. tCO2e, Delta: (50,7 %). Ziel für 2030: 12,5 Mio. tCO2e, Delta: (50 %). 3. **Real Estate**: Buchwert von 66,3 € Mrd. (8,6 % des Gesamtwerts). Retrospektive Zielwerte: 21,0 kg CO2e/m² (2024) vs. 33,5 (2023), Delta: (37,4 %). Ziel für 2030: ca. 20 kg CO2e/m². 4. **Investitionen ohne Methodologie für Kohlenstoffbilanzierung**: Buchwert von 106,8 € Mrd. (13,9 % des Gesamtwerts). 5. **Investitionen ohne Zielsetzung**: Buchwert von 224,3 € Mrd. (29,3 % des Gesamtwerts). Retrospektive Zielwerte: 30,3 Mio. tCO2e (2024) vs. 36,7 (2023), Delta: (17,6 %). 6. **Gesamtwert**: Buchwert von 767,0 € Mrd. (100 % des Gesamtwerts).

Je suis désolé, mais les documents fournis ne contiennent pas l'information sur le total exact des émissions liées à l'activité d'assurance (insurance associated emissions) pour toutes les années ou régions. Cependant, pour l'année 2024, les émissions associées à l'assurance commerciale étaient de 1.02 millions de tonnes de CO2e. Pour des informations plus détaillées ou spécifiques, je vous recommande de consulter les rapports annuels de l'entreprise ou leur site internet.

The Allianz Group discloses GHG intensity with the following considerations for the numerator and denominator: − Net revenue: The Allianz Group does not report a net revenue figure so total business volume is used instead. − Total GHG emissions : The majority of emissions for an insurance company are concentrated in Scope 3, Category 15. We are constrained by the current development of methodologies and the availability of data. Consequently, we are not yet able to comprehensively cover emissions from all business activities contributing to the total business volume. 272.2 356.0 Total GHG emissions (location -based)2 t in CO 2e 49,067,050.4 57,6 88,706.5 GHG intensity (location -based) t in CO 2e/€ mn 272.9 356.8 1_As per the table "Business segment information – total business volume and reconciliation of operating profit (loss) to net income (loss) in the notes to the consolidated financia l statements." 2_Excluding insurance -associated emissions. We are constrained by the current development of methodologies and the availability of data. Consequently, we are not yet able to comprehensively cover emissions from all business activities contributing to the total business volume.

Insurance – associated emissions – Commercial Underwriting Portfolio While we deem IAE not mandatory under E1 of the ESRS, we have developed entity -specific metrics to report these emissions, based on the methodology of PCAF 1. For more information, please refer to the Explanatory Notes on the Allianz company website . Scope The portfolio in scope of the IAE intensity reduction target covers the sub-portfolio of large corporate companies insured by AGCS for which GHG emission data is available . This includes insurance policies from lines of business listed below. PCAF requirements prescribe excluding specific lines of business across different segments. In-scope commercial lines of business: − Property, − Liability/Casualty, − Commercial Motor, − Aviation, − Marine, − Agriculture, − Engineering lines (except those out of scope), − Other/special lines (e.g., financial lines , workers compensation ), and bonds can be found in the Explanatory Notes on the Allianz company website .   • 2 emission reduction target. Currently, we have defined an entity -specific metric to calculate the Scope 1 and 2 emissions of customers using the PCAF methodology. Allianz will continue to use PCAF as the standard for calculating insurance -associated emissions while reporting on the target progression to ensure the consistency and replicability of the reported values. A yearly calculation of the insurance -associated emissio ns of the target portfolio is performed and reported, with in - scope markets providing quarterly updates throughout the year. The main metric to be compared year -on-year will be the absolute emissions of the in -scope portfolios. In addition, for the insured customers decarbonization lever, an analysis of the real -worl d economy (e.g., customer CO 2 emission reductions and implementation of governmental commitments) is compared with the expected 2 emission reduction target.   • intensity target of 0.14 kt CO 2e/mn € insurance premium would correspond to associated absolute GHG emissions of 0.63 mn t CO 2e for 2030. This figure is an illustrative view rather than an accurate representation of the expected absolute emissions in the target year and will change due to ou r dynamic portfolio. As our portfolio grows in business volume and data coverage increases, enabling us to report on more of the portfolio, we expect the associated absolute GHG emissions to grow as well. 2_Insurance Premium is equal to Insurance Revenue minus external acquisition costs . While the decision to define an intensity target allows us to reflect the expected growth of our portfolio by 2030 in a dynamic way, we have ensured that our targeted reduction is still within the scenario range to limit global warming to 1.5 °C. Specifically, we have aimed to set an emission reduction target in the ranges of the IPCC net -zero scenarios by 2030. We also considered a growth in premium to intensity target of 0.14 kt CO 2e/mn € insurance premium would correspond to associated absolute GHG emissions of 0.63 mn t CO 2e for 2030.   • commercial insurance, the 2024 insurance associated emis sions were 1.02 mn t CO 2e1 and the insurance -associated emission intensity was 0.23 kt CO₂e/ € mn Insurance Premium2. The IAE for a commercial insurance policy is equal to the GHG emissions (Scope 1 and 2) from the policyholder multiplied by the attribution factor provided by PCAF (insurance premium of the policy divided by the revenue of the customer). Additionally, specific assumptions for policies covering risks of assets linked to Renewables and Low- Carbon technologies are taken to discount the IAE linke d to these policies. For commercial insurance, an emission intensity reduction has been achieved in 2024 compared to the baseline, decreasing from 0.26 kt CO 2e/mn € Insurance Premium in 2022 to 0.23 ktvCO 2e/mn € in 2024. This marks an 11.7 % reduction from the 2022 baseline and a 6.4 % increase compared to 2023. For the motor retail portfolios covered by the emission reduction commercial insurance, the 2024 insurance associated emis sions were 1.02 mn t CO 2e1 and the insurance -associated emission intensity was 0.23 kt CO₂e/ € mn Insurance Premium2. The IAE for a commercial insurance policy is equal to the GHG emissions (Scope 1 and 2) from the policyholder multiplied by the attribution factor provided by PCAF (insurance premium of the policy divided by the revenue of the customer). Additionally, specific assumptions for policies covering risks of assets linked to Renewables and Low- Carbon technologies are taken to discount the IAE linke d to these policies. For commercial insurance, an emission intensity reduction has been achieved in 2024 compared to the baseline, decreasing from 0.26 kt CO 2e/mn € Insurance Premium in 2022 to 0.23 ktvCO 2e/mn € in 2024. This marks an 11.7 % reduction from the 2022 baseline and a 6.4 % increase compared to 2023. For the motor retail portfolios covered by the emission reduction
  • Scope Scope 3 GHG emissions consist of indirect emissions that occur in our company’s upstream and downstream value chain, and most significantly of the companies we insure and invest in, in line with the GHG Protocol. Methodology – Total gross indirect Scope 3 GHG emissions Total gross indirect Scope 3 GHG emissions (tCO₂eq) are calculated as the sum of all categories of Scope 3 GHG emissions across our upstream and downstream value chain. Category 1 – Purchased goods and services This consists of paper and public cloud services. Paper use is monitored and reported for internal or external purposes, with the following environmental attributes: − Paper from certified sustainable sources – recycled or virgin fibers , and − Paper from non -certified sources. Methodology − Paper: Data is based on invoice amounts (where available) and estimations from entities.   • be part of the fossi l fuel value chain. Beyond that, the end -use of fossil fuels is not in scope of this criterion (e.g., combustion engine vehicles or oil-fired heating systems). Thus, the DNSH criterion is automatically fulfilled for retail business, as private use is consi dered as end -use. In our portfolio screening approach, we applied the International Standard of Industrial Classification of economic activities (ISIC codes) to identify insurance policies which are not in line with the DNSH criterion as defined above: The different ISIC co des have been classified as either compliant with DNSH, not compliant with DNSH, or to be assessed on an individual customer level. We have screened our portfolios against this internal classification system. As our commercial risks are allocated to ISIC codes (or comparable national or internal classifications), we could identify insurance policies and revenues which do not comply with DNSH. be part of the fossi l fuel value chain. Beyond that, the end -use of fossil fuels is not in scope of this criterion (e.g., combustion engine vehicles or oil-fired heating systems). Thus, the DNSH criterion is automatically fulfilled for retail business, as private use is consi dered as end -use. We have screened our portfolios against this internal classification system. E1-15

L'entreprise est-elle concernée par les critères d'exclusion des indices de référence de l'Accord de Paris ? Pour répondre à cette question, il convient de déterminer si l'entreprise possède l'une des caractéristiques suivantes:

Elle participe à la production ou à la commercialisation d'armes controversées
Elle est impliquée dans la culture ou la production de tabac
Elle ne respecte pas les principes directeurs de l'OCDE ou viole les principes du Pacte mondial des Nations Unies.
Elle tire au moins 1% de son chiffre d'affaires des énergies fossiles.



Si l'une de ces caractéristiques est avérée, l'entreprise est concernée par les critères d'exclusion. En revanche, si aucune information n'est disponible concernant ces caractéristiques, cela signifie que l'entreprise n'est pas concernée par les critères d'exclusion de l'indice de référence de l'Accord de Paris.

Je ne sais pas. Les informations fournies ne contiennent pas suffisamment de détails pour déterminer si l'entreprise est concernée par les critères d'exclusion des indices de référence de l'Accord de Paris. Les documents n'indiquent pas explicitement si l'entreprise participe à la production ou à la commercialisation d'armes controversées, est impliquée dans la culture ou la production de tabac, ne respecte pas les principes directeurs de l'OCDE ou viole les principes du Pacte mondial des Nations Unies, ou tire au moins 1% de son chiffre d'affaires des énergies fossiles.


Afficher les sourcesLLM
Sources LLM :
  • Le tableau présente deux catégories d'activités : **activités liées à l'énergie nucléaire** et **activités liées au gaz fossile**, avec une colonne "YES/NO" indiquant si l'entreprise mène, finance ou est exposée à ces activités. Pour les **activités nucléaires** : 1. Les activités de recherche, développement, démonstration et déploiement d'installations innovantes produisant de l'énergie nucléaire avec des déchets minimaux sont marquées "NO". 2. Les activités de construction et d'exploitation sécurisée de nouvelles installations nucléaires pour produire de l'électricité ou de la chaleur, y compris pour le chauffage urbain ou des processus industriels comme la production d'hydrogène, sont marquées "YES". 3. Les activités d'exploitation sécurisée des installations nucléaires existantes pour produire de l'électricité ou de la chaleur, y compris pour le chauffage urbain ou des processus industriels comme la production d'hydrogène, sont également marquées "YES". Pour les **activités liées au gaz fossile** : 4. La construction ou l'exploitation d'installations de production d'électricité utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles est marquée "YES". 5. La construction, rénovation et exploitation d'installations de cogénération de chaleur/refroidissement et d'électricité utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles sont marquées "YES". 6. La construction, rénovation et exploitation d'installations de production de chaleur/refroidissement utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles sont également marquées "YES". and

    BEGIN TABLE

    Row Nuclear energy related activities YES/NO
    1 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to research, development, demonstration and deployment of innovative electricity generation facilities that produce energy from nuclear processes with minimal waste from the fuel cycle. NO
    2 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to construction and safe operation of new nuclear installations to produce electricity or process heat, including for the purposes of district heating or industrial processes such as hydrogen production, as well as their safety upgrades, using best available technologies. YES
    3 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to safe operation of existing nuclear installations that produce electricity or process heat, including for the purposes of district heating or industrial processes such as hydrogen production from nuclear energy, as well as their safety upgrades. YES
    ----- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------
    Row Fossil gas related activities YES/NO
    4 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to construction or operation of electricity generation facilities that produce electricity using fossil gaseous fuels. YES
    5 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to construction, refurbishment, and operation of combined heat/cool and power generation facilities using fossil gaseous fuels. YES
    6 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to construction, refurbishment and operation of heat generation facilities that produce heat/cool using fossil gaseous fuels. YES

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente deux catégories d'activités : celles liées à l'énergie nucléaire et celles liées au gaz fossile. Pour les activités nucléaires, seules les activités de construction et d'exploitation sécurisée des installations nucléaires, qu'elles soient nouvelles ou existantes, sont marquées comme "YES". Les activités de recherche et développement pour des installations innovantes produisant de l'énergie nucléaire avec des déchets minimaux sont marquées "NO". En ce qui concerne les activités liées au gaz fossile, toutes les activités mentionnées, qu'il s'agisse de la construction, de la rénovation ou de l'exploitation d'installations de production d'électricité, de chaleur ou de refroidissement utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles, sont marquées "YES".

  • Restrictions In line with our guidelines on thermal coal, oil sands, and oil and gas, and as we see the future of these business models endangered, we restrict certain fossil fuel companies or projects (divestment for equity and run-off for debt investments). For more details, see section E1 Climate change. Allianz prohibits investments in controversial weapons as defined in the ASIS. Since 2023, we have placed further restrictions on companies not complying with the U.N. Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons. Annual Report 2024 − Allianz Group _ C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement Restrictions In line with our guidelines on thermal coal, oil sands, and oil and gas, and as we see the future of these business models endangered, we restrict certain fossil fuel companies or projects (divestment for equity and run-off for debt investments). For more details, see section E1 Climate change. Allianz prohibits investments in controversial weapons as defined in the ASIS. Since 2023, we have placed further restrictions on companies not complying with the U.N. Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons. Annual Report 2024 − Allianz Group _ C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement
  • Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les exigences de divulgation et les points de données associés, classés par leur matérialité ("matériel", "non matériel" ou "non pertinent") et leurs sous-sections ou sous-sous-sections. Les exigences matérielles incluent : 1. **ESRS S2-1** : Non-respect des principes des UNGPs et des lignes directrices de l'OCDE (paragraphe 19) et politiques de diligence raisonnable liées aux conventions fondamentales de l'OIT (1 à 8, paragraphe 19), dans les sous-sections "politiques Allianz ESRS" et "stratégie et modèle d'affaires liés aux travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur". 2. **ESRS S2-4** : Questions et incidents relatifs aux droits humains dans la chaîne de valeur (paragraphe 36), avec des cibles, actions et processus pour remédier aux impacts négatifs. 3. **ESRS S3-1** : Engagements politiques en matière de droits humains (paragraphe 16) et non-respect des principes des UNGPs, de l'OIT ou de l'OCDE (paragraphe 17), dans le cadre de la stratégie et du modèle d'affaires liés aux communautés affectées. 4. **ESRS S3-4** : Questions et incidents relatifs aux droits humains (paragraphe 36), avec des actions et processus d'engagement avec les communautés affectées. 5. **ESRS S4-4** : Questions et incidents relatifs aux droits humains (paragraphe 35), avec des actions. 6. **ESRS G1-4** : Incidents confirmés de corruption ou de pots-de-vin (paragraphes 24 (a) et (b)). Les points non matériels ou non pertinents incluent : - **ESRS S4-1** : Politiques liées aux consommateurs et utilisateurs finaux (paragraphes 16 et 17), jugées non applicables. - **ESRS G1-1** : Convention des Nations Unies contre la corruption (paragraphe 10 (b)) et protection des lanceurs d'alerte (paragraphe 10 (d)), avec des politiques déjà en place. and

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les exigences de divulgation liées à divers aspects des droits humains, de la corruption et des politiques de diligence raisonnable. Il indique si ces exigences sont considérées comme "matérielles", "non matérielles" ou "non pertinentes", et précise les sous-sections ou sous-sous-sections associées. Les points matériels incluent des politiques et des actions liées aux droits humains, aux travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur, aux communautés affectées, ainsi qu'aux incidents confirmés de corruption ou de pots-de-vin. Les points non matériels ou non pertinents concernent principalement les politiques déjà en place ou les aspects jugés non applicables.

  • Le tableau présente les catégories du Scope 3 et leur statut d'inclusion ou d'exclusion. Les 15 catégories sont listées comme suit : 1. "Purchased goods and services" est exclue. 2. "Capital goods" est exclue. 3. "Fuel and energy-related activities (not included in Scope 1 or Scope 2)" est incluse. 4. "Upstream transportation and distribution" est exclue. 5. "Waste generated in operation" est exclue. 6. "Business traveling" est incluse. 7. "Employee commuting" est exclue. 8. "Upstream leased assets" est exclue. 9. "Downstream transportation" est exclue. 10. "Processing of sold products" est exclue. 11. "Use of sold products" est exclue. 12. "End-of-life treatment of sold products" est incluse. 13. "Downstream leased assets" est exclue. 14. "Franchises" est incluse. 15. "Investments" est incluse. En résumé, seules 5 catégories sont incluses : les activités liées au carburant et à l'énergie (non incluses dans les Scopes 1 et 2), les déplacements professionnels, le traitement en fin de vie des produits vendus, les franchises et les investissements. and

    BEGIN TABLE

    Scope 3 categories Included/Excluded
    1 Purchased goods and services Excluded
    2 Capital goods Excluded
    3 Fuel and energy-related activities (not included in Scope 1 or Scope 2) Included
    4 Upstream transportation and distribution Excluded
    5 Waste generated in operation Excluded
    6 Business traveling Included
    7 Employee commuting Excluded
    8 Upstream leased assets Excluded
    9 Downstream transportation Excluded
    10 Processing of sold products Excluded
    11 Use of sold products Excluded
    12 End-of-life treatment of sold products Included
    13 Downstream leased assets Excluded
    14 Franchises Included
    15 Investments Included

    Résumé : Le tableau présente les catégories du Scope 3 et indique si elles sont incluses ou exclues. Parmi les 15 catégories, seules 5 sont incluses : les activités liées au carburant et à l'énergie (non incluses dans les Scopes 1 et 2), les déplacements professionnels, le traitement en fin de vie des produits vendus, les franchises et les investissements. Les autres catégories, telles que les biens achetés, les biens d'équipement, le transport en amont et en aval, ainsi que l'utilisation des produits vendus, sont exclues.

  • 3_We have updated our 2030 target values to the 2028 Transition Pathway Initiative benchmark values, which are appropriate as they reflect the one year time lag in our emission data. Restrictions Second, we restrict certain companies in line with our global energy- related guidelines for thermal coal, oil sands, and oil & gas. For further information, please refer to the section Allianz ESRS policies. These restrictions also contribute to the implementation of our sector targets for oil & gas and utilities. All restricted companies are included in the Allianz Group Risk Global Restricted (GRGR) List and are shared with all asset managers on a regular basis. Asset managers are obliged to comply with these restrictions. 3_We have updated our 2030 target values to the 2028 Transition Pathway Initiative benchmark values, which are appropriate as they reflect the one year time lag in our emission data. Restrictions Second, we restrict certain companies in line with our global energy- related guidelines for thermal coal, oil sands, and oil & gas. For further information, please refer to the section Allianz ESRS policies. These restrictions also contribute to the implementation of our sector targets for oil & gas and utilities. All restricted companies are included in the Allianz Group Risk Global Restricted (GRGR) List and are shared with all asset managers on a regular basis. Asset managers are obliged to comply with these restrictions.

Les exigences "non matérielles" ou "non pertinentes" concernent les activités liées aux combustibles fossiles, à la production chimique, aux armes controversées, au tabac (paragraphe 40 (d)), ainsi que les crédits carbone (paragraphe 56). and

Les éléments "non matériels" ou "non pertinents" incluent les activités liées aux combustibles fossiles, à la production chimique, aux armes controversées, au tabac, et aux crédits carbone.

  • Restrictions We are also applying the Allianz energy guidelines, which relate to discontinuing restricted business linked to coal assets or companies falling under restriction criteria for thermal coal, oil sands, oil & gas. For further information, please refer to the section Policy inventory and governance related to Climate Change Mitigation.   • Le tableau présente deux catégories d'activités : celles liées à l'énergie nucléaire et celles liées aux gaz fossiles. - **Pour les activités liées à l'énergie nucléaire** : - La recherche, le développement et le déploiement d'installations innovantes produisant de l'énergie avec des déchets minimaux ne sont pas réalisés (**NO**, ligne 1). - La construction et l'exploitation sécurisée de nouvelles installations nucléaires, y compris pour le chauffage urbain ou les processus industriels, sont réalisées (**YES**, ligne 2). - L'exploitation sécurisée des installations nucléaires existantes, y compris pour le chauffage urbain ou les processus industriels, est également réalisée (**YES**, ligne 3). - **Pour les activités liées aux gaz fossiles** : - La construction ou l'exploitation d'installations de production d'électricité utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles n'est pas réalisée (**NO**, ligne 4). - La construction, la rénovation et l'exploitation d'installations combinées de production de chaleur/froid et d'électricité utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles ne sont pas réalisées (**NO**, ligne 5). - La construction, la rénovation et l'exploitation d'installations de production de chaleur/froid utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles ne sont pas réalisées (**NO**, ligne 6). and

    BEGIN TABLE

    Row Nuclear energy related activities YES/NO
    1 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to research, development, demonstration and deployment of innovative electricity generation facilities that produce energy from nuclear processes with minimal waste from the fuel cycle. NO
    2 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to construction and safe operation of new nuclear installations to produce electricity or process heat, including for the purposes of district heating or industrial processes such as hydrogen production, as well as their safety upgrades, using best available technologies. YES
    3 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to safe operation of existing nuclear installations that produce electricity or process heat, including for the purposes of district heating or industrial processes such as hydrogen production from nuclear energy, as well as their safety upgrades.     Row Fossil gas related activities YES/NO
    ----- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ --------
    4 The undertaking carries out, funds, or has exposures to construction or operation of electricity generation facilities that produce electricity using fossil gaseous fuels. NO
    5 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to construction, refurbishment, and operation of combined heat/cool and power generation facilities using fossil gaseous fuels. NO
    6 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to construction, refurbishment and operation of heat generation facilities that produce heat/cool using fossil gaseous fuels. NO

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente deux catégories d'activités : celles liées à l'énergie nucléaire et celles liées aux gaz fossiles.
    - Pour les activités liées à l'énergie nucléaire : - La recherche, le développement et le déploiement d'installations innovantes produisant de l'énergie avec des déchets minimaux ne sont pas réalisés (NO). - La construction et l'exploitation sécurisée de nouvelles installations nucléaires, y compris pour le chauffage urbain ou les processus industriels, sont réalisées (YES). - L'exploitation sécurisée des installations nucléaires existantes, y compris pour le chauffage urbain ou les processus industriels, est également réalisée (YES).
    - Pour les activités liées aux gaz fossiles : - La construction ou l'exploitation d'installations de production d'électricité utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles n'est pas réalisée (NO). - La construction, la rénovation et l'exploitation d'installations combinées de production de chaleur/froid et d'électricité utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles ne sont pas réalisées (NO). - La construction, la rénovation et l'exploitation d'installations de production de chaleur/froid utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles ne sont pas réalisées (NO).

  • Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau détaille les "exigences de divulgation et points de données associés", leur "matérialité" (matériel ou non matériel), et les "sous-sections/sous-sous-sections" correspondantes. Les points matériels incluent : 1. **ESRS E4-2** : Politiques sur les océans/mer et la déforestation, liées à la biodiversité et aux écosystèmes. 2. **ESRS E5-5** : Déchets non recyclés et dangereux, liés à l'économie circulaire et à l'utilisation des ressources. 3. **ESRS S1-1** : Engagements en matière de droits humains, politiques de diligence raisonnable, prévention des accidents, et mécanismes de gestion des plaintes, liés à la main-d'œuvre propre. 4. **ESRS S1-14** : Santé et sécurité, incluant les accidents et jours perdus. 5. **ESRS S1-16** : Écarts de rémunération entre genres et ratios de rémunération. 6. **ESRS S1-17** : Incidents de discrimination et non-respect des principes directeurs de l'ONU et des lignes directrices de l'OCDE, liés aux droits humains dans la main-d'œuvre propre. 7. **ESRS 2-SBM-3 - S2** : Risques significatifs de travail des enfants ou forcé dans la chaîne de valeur. 8. **ESRS S2-1** : Engagements en matière de droits humains pour les travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur. Les points non matériels incluent les risques d'incidents de travail forcé ou des enfants (ESRS 2-SBM-3 - S1) et les mesures contre la traite humaine (ESRS S1-1). and

    BEGIN TABLE

    Disclosure requirement and related datapoint Materiality Sub-section/sub-sub-section
