    Cases of recordable work-related ill health of employees # 274 534
    Number of days lost to work-related fatalities/accidents/ill health of employees # 21,251 20,292

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : - En 2024, 96.9 % des employés sont couverts par un système de gestion de la santé et de la sécurité, contre une donnée non disponible pour 2023. - Aucun décès d'employés lié à des blessures ou maladies professionnelles n'est enregistré en 2024, contre un décès en 2023. - Aucun décès d'autres travailleurs sur site lié à des blessures ou maladies professionnelles n'est enregistré en 2024, avec une donnée non disponible pour 2023. - Le nombre d'accidents de travail enregistrables chez les employés diminue, passant de 847 en 2023 à 728 en 2024. - Le taux d'accidents de travail enregistrables par million d'heures de travail diminue également, passant de 3.7 en 2023 à 3.3 en 2024. - Les cas de maladies professionnelles enregistrables chez les employés diminuent significativement, passant de 534 en 2023 à 274 en 2024. - Le nombre de jours perdus en raison de décès, d'accidents ou de maladies professionnelles augmente légèrement, passant de 20,292 en 2023 à 21,251 en 2024.

  • Le tableau présente les émissions de gaz à effet de serre (GES) des investissements propriétaires pour les années 2024 et 2023, réparties selon les catégories et les Scopes 1, 2 et 3. Les émissions du Scope 1, provenant des actifs réels au bilan, ont diminué de 38,4 %, passant de 28,778.8 en 2023 à 17,723.7 en 2024. Les émissions du Scope 2 basées sur la localisation ont augmenté de 23,3 %, passant de 60,179.5 en 2023 à 74,180.8 en 2024, tandis que celles basées sur le marché ont augmenté de 38,7 %, passant de 38,062.9 en 2023 à 52,804.1 en 2024. Les émissions significatives du Scope 3 ont diminué de 15,1 %, passant de 57,359,001.7 en 2023 à 48,717,427 en 2024, principalement en raison de la baisse des émissions liées aux investissements (de 57,268,098.1 en 2023 à 48,626,453.1 en 2024). Les émissions des actifs loués en aval ont légèrement augmenté de 0,1 %, passant de 90,903.6 en 2023 à 90,974.1 en 2024. Les émissions totales des investissements propriétaires basées sur la localisation ont diminué de 15 %, passant de 57,447,960.0 en 2023 à 48,809,331.7 en 2024. De même, les émissions totales des investissements propriétaires basées sur le marché ont diminué de 15 %, passant de 57,425,843.4 en 2023 à 48,787,955.1 en 2024. and

    BEGIN TABLE

    Catégorie 2024 2023 Variation en %
    Scope 1 Emissions
    Émissions de GES du Scope 1 provenant des actifs réels au bilan 17,723.7 28,778.8 (38.4)
    Scope 2 GHG Emissions
    Émissions de GES du Scope 2 basées sur la localisation provenant des actifs réels au bilan 74,180.8 60,179.5 23.3
    Émissions de GES du Scope 2 basées sur le marché provenant des actifs réels au bilan 52,804.1 38,062.9 38.7
    Émissions significatives du Scope 3 GHG
    Total 48,717,427 57,359,001.7 (15.1)
    13 Actifs loués en aval 90,974.1 90,903.6 0.1
    15 Investissements 48,626,453.1 57,268,098.1 (15.1)
    Total des émissions de GES des investissements propriétaires (basées sur la localisation) 48,809,331.7 57,447,960.0 (15.0)
    Total des émissions de GES des investissements propriétaires (basées sur le marché) 48,787,955.1 57,425,843.4 (15.0)

    Résumé du tableau : Le tableau présente les émissions de gaz à effet de serre (GES) pour les années 2024 et 2023, réparties selon les Scopes 1, 2 et 3. Les émissions du Scope 1 ont diminué de 38,4 %, tandis que celles du Scope 2 ont augmenté, avec une hausse de 23,3 % pour les émissions basées sur la localisation et de 38,7 % pour celles basées sur le marché. Les émissions significatives du Scope 3 ont diminué de 15,1 %, principalement en raison de la baisse des émissions liées aux investissements. Les émissions totales des investissements propriétaires, qu'elles soient basées sur la localisation ou le marché, ont également diminué de 15 %.

L'entreprise Allianz met en place plusieurs mesures pour fournir et faciliter des recours en cas d'impacts sur les droits de l'homme. Voici les principales actions décrites dans les contextes fournis :

  1. Mécanisme de plaintes indépendant : Allianz a mis en place un mécanisme de plaintes indépendant, SpeakUp@Allianz, qui permet à toute personne, qu'elle soit interne ou externe à l'entreprise, de signaler des problèmes liés aux droits de l'homme des travailleurs dans la chaîne de valeur (Context Num-3).

  2. Engagements contractuels et mesures préventives : Lors du processus d'intégration des fournisseurs, Allianz s'assure que les fournisseurs se conforment à un code de conduite qui respecte les droits de l'homme. Des actions préventives sont prises en cas de risques identifiés, incluant des clauses contractuelles liées aux droits de l'homme (Context Num-4).

  3. Surveillance continue : Allianz surveille continuellement ses portefeuilles d'assurance et d'investissement pour prévenir d'éventuelles violations graves des droits de l'homme (Context Num-3).

  4. Évaluations et mesures correctives : Allianz effectue des évaluations annuelles et ad hoc des risques pour les droits des employés, et prend des mesures correctives immédiates et efficaces en cas de violations (Context Num-5).

Ces mesures illustrent l'engagement d'Allianz à aborder et à remédier aux impacts potentiels sur les droits de l'homme dans sa chaîne de valeur et ses propres opérations.


Afficher les sourcesLLM
Sources LLM2 :
  • ### Targets, actions, channels to raise concerns and processes to remediate negative impacts on value chain workers Actions taken and processes implemented by Allianz to assess and address (potential) human rights impacts on value chain workers depend on the stage of the value chain, while they are all guided by the UNGPs. ### Targets, actions, channels to raise concerns and processes to remediate negative impacts on value chain workers Actions taken and processes implemented by Allianz to assess and address (potential) human rights impacts on value chain workers depend on the stage of the value chain, while they are all guided by the UNGPs.
  • To mitigate potential human rights impacts, we employ the policies and procedures outlined in this section. This includes channels to raise concerns and due diligence for possible impacts on workers in our value chain. The identified impacts have the potential to translate into risks for Allianz. These risks encompass reputational, operational, consumer, and human behavior-related risk, as well as legal risks. Allianz recognizes these risks and has implemented various mitigation actions and initiatives to address them; see section [Policies related to workers in the value chain](#). To mitigate potential human rights impacts, we employ the policies and procedures outlined in this section. This includes channels to raise concerns and due diligence for possible impacts on workers in our value chain. The identified impacts have the potential to translate into risks for Allianz. These risks encompass reputational, operational, consumer, and human behavior-related risk, as well as legal risks. Allianz recognizes these risks and has implemented various mitigation actions and initiatives to address them; see section [Policies related to workers in the value chain](#).
  • While Allianz has not adopted a dedicated process to engage with value chain workers, human rights issues can be addressed through existing engagement channels. Everyone inside and outside Allianz can report issues related to the human rights of workers in our value chain through our independent complaints mechanism, *SpeakUp@Allianz*, which is further detailed in the section *G.1 Business conduct*. In 2024, no severe human rights violations of value chain workers were reported through *SpeakUp@Allianz*. Adverse media screenings of potentially high-risk suppliers did not produce any information on human rights violations in our supply chain in 2024. For our insurance and proprietary investment, the *ASIS* process is designed to prevent Allianz from insuring or investing in companies that cause severe human rights violations. We continuously monitor our portfolios to be able to address violations should they occur. While Allianz has not adopted a dedicated process to engage with value chain workers, human rights issues can be addressed through existing engagement channels. Everyone inside and outside Allianz can report issues related to the human rights of workers in our value chain through our independent complaints mechanism, *SpeakUp@Allianz*, which is further detailed in the section *G.1 Business conduct*. In 2024, no severe human rights violations of value chain workers were reported through *SpeakUp@Allianz*. Adverse media screenings of potentially high-risk suppliers did not produce any information on human rights violations in our supply chain in 2024. For our insurance and proprietary investment, the *ASIS* process is designed to prevent Allianz from insuring or investing in companies that cause severe human rights violations. We continuously monitor our portfolios to be able to address violations should they occur.
  • During the supplier onboarding process, suppliers registered in our standard tool for procurement are asked to comply with the VCoC or to submit a comparable code of conduct. For suppliers over a defined threshold, we apply additional checks, including questions on their human rights due diligence. This mitigates the risk of engaging with suppliers who do not uphold human rights standards. Additional actions and processes are based on voluntary commitments as well as the requirements of the _GSCA_. If risks related to violations of human rights of supply chain workers are identified, we take appropriate preventive measures, including, for example, engaging with the companies in question or adding human rights-related contractual clauses to the supplier agreement. If we identify human rights violations in our supply chain, we seek to take remedial action, in line with our ability to influence suppliers. We will sever the supplier relationship as a last resort. During the supplier onboarding process, suppliers registered in our standard tool for procurement are asked to comply with the VCoC or to submit a comparable code of conduct. For suppliers over a defined threshold, we apply additional checks, including questions on their human rights due diligence. This mitigates the risk of engaging with suppliers who do not uphold human rights standards. Additional actions and processes are based on voluntary commitments as well as the requirements of the _GSCA_. If risks related to violations of human rights of supply chain workers are identified, we take appropriate preventive measures, including, for example, engaging with the companies in question or adding human rights-related contractual clauses to the supplier agreement. If we identify human rights violations in our supply chain, we seek to take remedial action, in line with our ability to influence suppliers. We will sever the supplier relationship as a last resort.
  • # Integrating Sustainability in Own Operations We consider human rights as a minimum standard for the treatment of our employees. We conduct annual and ad-hoc assessments of risks to employee rights per the GSCA. If we find risks, we take preventive measures. If we find violations, we remedy them promptly and effectively (see our [Policy Statement on Human Rights](URL)). We have implemented measures to minimize risks to human rights and labor standards in our own operations. These include: - The protection of human rights is enshrined in our corporate rules, depending on local laws and requirements. - Anonymous feedback tools and surveys let employees evaluate issues like workload, wages, and diversity. - Extensive measures ensure physical safety and improve health and well-being. - Training in sustainability-related issues, including equal treatment and occupational health & safety, at Group and subsidiary levels. # Integrating Sustainability in Own Operations We consider human rights as a minimum standard for the treatment of our employees. We conduct annual and ad-hoc assessments of risks to employee rights per the GSCA. If we find risks, we take preventive measures. If we find violations, we remedy them promptly and effectively (see our [Policy Statement on Human Rights](URL)). We have implemented measures to minimize risks to human rights and labor standards in our own operations. These include: - The protection of human rights is enshrined in our corporate rules, depending on local laws and requirements. - Anonymous feedback tools and surveys let employees evaluate issues like workload, wages, and diversity. - Extensive measures ensure physical safety and improve health and well-being. - Training in sustainability-related issues, including equal treatment and occupational health & safety, at Group and subsidiary levels.

  • On the basis of our risk assessments, we have identified the following human rights as the most relevant for our own workforce in the context of our business model: equal treatment, adequate wages, freedom of association and collective bargaining, and occupational health and safety. For details on our policies, actions, and targets on these specific rights, please refer to the relevant sections of S1 Own workforce and the Allianz company website. Our official global complaints mechanism SpeakUp@Allianz gives our employees, and everyone else, the opportunity to raise concerns including risks to, and violations of, human rights. The complaints mechanism is widely promoted through the Allianz intranet and other channels, and it forms part of the global training on violation reporting under GCSA. For further information on the channel, please refer to the section Corruption and bribery. Investments - Proprietary Investments¹ - 48,626,453.1 - 57,268,098.1 - (15.1) - Intensity target in place - see table "Allianz 2030 GHG emission reduction targets"

Allianz met en place plusieurs mesures pour fournir et/ou faciliter des recours en cas d'impacts sur les droits de l'homme. L'une des principales initiatives est le mécanisme de plaintes mondial appelé SpeakUp@Allianz, accessible à tous les employés d'Allianz, ainsi qu'aux employés de ses fournisseurs directs et indirects, et à toute autre personne pouvant être impactée par les activités économiques d'Allianz. Ce mécanisme permet aux individus de signaler des risques pour les droits de l'homme et des violations qui ont résulté des activités économiques d'Allianz ou de ses fournisseurs. Les experts en conformité d'Allianz, responsables du traitement des rapports soumis via SpeakUp@Allianz, sont indépendants et respectent les règles de confidentialité.

De plus, Allianz s'assure qu'aucune mesure de représailles n'est prise contre les lanceurs d'alerte, reflétant son engagement à favoriser une culture de prise de parole saine au sein de l'entreprise. Les incidents signalés sont évalués, documentés et gérés conformément aux directives internes stipulées dans la politique de conformité d'Allianz.

  • To mitigate potential human rights impacts, we employ the policies and procedures outlined in this section. This includes channels to raise concerns and due diligence for possible impacts on workers in our value chain. The identified impacts have the potential to translate into risks for Allianz. These risks encompass reputational, operational, consumer, and human behavior-related risk, as well as legal risks. Allianz recognizes these risks and has implemented various mitigation actions and initiatives to address them; see section Policies related to workers in the value chain.

In 2024, no severe human rights violations of value chain workers were reported through SpeakUp@Alllianz. Adverse media screenings of potentially high-risk suppliers did not produce any information on human rights violations in our supply chain in 2024.   • # --- Page 83 --- ## C_ Group Management Report_ Sustainability Statement ### Targets, actions, channels to raise concerns and processes to remediate negative impacts on value chain workers Actions taken and processes implemented by Allianz to assess and address (potential) human rights impacts on value chain workers depend on the stage of the value chain, while they are all guided by the UNGPs.
  • Allianz aims to identify, prevent, mitigate or remediate adverse human rights impacts linked to its business activities and operations, including our supply chain. Our approach is guided by the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises and the U.N. Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights (UNGP). Our due diligence in own operations and supply chains complies with the legal obligations of the German Supply Chain Due Diligence Act (GSCA) and is covered by the Allianz SE Human Rights Policy Statement. Please refer to the sections S1 Own workforce and S2 Workers in the value chain for further details. Our due diligence process for proprietary investments and commercial insurance can be found in the sections S2 Workers in the value chain and S3 Affected communities of this report.
  • ### Processes and channels to raise concerns For further information, please refer to the sections Human rights in own workforce and Corruption and bribery.
  • On the basis of our risk assessments, we have identified the following human rights as the most relevant for our own workforce in the context of our business model: equal treatment, adequate wages, freedom of association and collective bargaining, and occupational health and safety. For details on our policies, actions, and targets on these specific rights, please refer to the relevant sections of S1 Own workforce and the Allianz company website. Our official global complaints mechanism SpeakUp@Allianz gives our employees, and everyone else, the opportunity to raise concerns including risks to, and violations of, human rights. The complaints mechanism is widely promoted through the Allianz intranet and other channels, and it forms part of the global training on violation reporting under GCSA. For further information on the channel, please refer to the section Corruption and bribery. We apply the following definition for human rights issues under ESRS:
  • ### BEGIN TABLE La tabla presenta datos sobre la intensidad de gases de efecto invernadero (GHG) y el volumen total de negocios de Allianz Group al 31 de diciembre de 2024 y 2023. - **Etiquetas de columnas**: "0", "1", "2", "3". - **Etiquetas de filas**: "As of 31 December", "Total business volume1", "Total GHG emissions (market-based)2", "GHG intensity (market-based)", "Total GHG emissions (location-based)2", "GHG intensity (location-based)". - **Años**: 2024 y 2023. **Datos clave**: 1. El volumen total de negocios ("Total business volume1") fue de **179,777.8 mn €** en 2024 y **161,700.0 mn €** en 2023. 2. Las emisiones totales de GHG basadas en el mercado ("Total GHG emissions (market-based)2") fueron de **48,932,692.3 t en CO2e** en 2024 y **57,562,291.4 t en CO2e** en 2023. 3. La intensidad de GHG basada en el mercado ("GHG intensity (market-based)") fue de **272.2 t en CO2e/€ mn** en 2024 y **356.0 t en CO2e/€ mn** en 2023. 4. Las emisiones totales de GHG basadas en la ubicación ("Total GHG emissions (location-based)2") fueron de **49,067,050.4 t en CO2e** en 2024 y **57,688,706.5 t en CO2e** en 2023. 5. La intensidad de GHG basada en la ubicación ("GHG intensity (location-based)") fue de **272.9 t en CO2e/€ mn** en 2024 y **356.8 t en CO2e/€ mn** en 2023. ### END TABLE

Las etiquetas de las columnas incluyen: "Retrospective", "Base year", "2024", "2023", "Delta in %", "Milestones and target years" (2025, 2030, 2050), y "Annual % target / Base year". Las filas principales son: 1. **"Purchased goods and services"**: Emisiones en 2024 fueron 8,993.5, con objetivos de intensidad establecidos. 2. **"Fuel and energy-related activities (not included in Scope 1 or Scope 2)"**: Emisiones en 2024 fueron 30,305.1, con objetivos de intensidad establecidos. 3. **"Business traveling"**: Emisiones en 2024 fueron 55,873.8 y en 2023, 96,745.1. 4. **"Employee commuting"**: Emisiones en 2024 fueron 7,456.9, considerando solo trabajo remoto. 5. **"Downstream leased assets"**: Emisiones en 2024 fueron 90,974.1 y en 2023, 90,903.6, con un cambio del 0.1%. 6. **"Investments - Proprietary Investments"**: Emisiones en 2024 fueron 48,626,453.1 y en 2023, 57,268,098.1, con un cambio de (15.1)%. Totales de emisiones de GEI: - **"Total GHG emissions (location-based)"**: 49,067,050.4 en 2024 y 57,688,706.5 en 2023, con un cambio de (14.9)%. - **"Total GHG emissions (market-based)"**: 48,932,692.3 en 2024 y 57,562,291.4 en 2023, con un cambio de (15.0)%. - **"Total GHG emissions inc. insurance (location-based)"**: 52,034,326.8 en 2024 y 60,665,061.5 en 2023, con un cambio de (14.2)%. Se mencionan objetivos de reducción de emisiones para 2030 y 2050, con detalles adicionales en secciones específicas del informe.
  • ### BEGIN TABLE La tabla presenta los KPI/targets para el año 2025, con un objetivo del 100 %. Los indicadores incluyen: 1. **Reducción de emisiones propias en inversiones**: Emisiones absolutas financiadas de GHG en millones de toneladas de CO2e provenientes de corporaciones listadas, con un objetivo de **12.3 mn t CO2e**. 2. **Digital Net Promoter Score (dNPS)**: Porcentaje de líderes de lealtad en segmentos de negocio, con un objetivo de **50 %**. 3. **Inclusive Meritocracy Index (IMIX)**: Desarrollo contra el nivel de ambición general, con un objetivo de **77 %**. 4. **Plan de transición hacia compromisos de cero emisiones netas**: Incluye reducción de emisiones en el sector de motor retail y reducción de intensidad de emisiones en el sector comercial de Property-Casualty. 5. **Soluciones sostenibles en Property-Casualty**. 6. **Desarrollo del Digital Net Promoter Score (dNPS)** contra el nivel de ambición general. 7. **Desarrollo del Inclusive Meritocracy Index (IMIX)** contra el nivel de ambición general. 8. **Cumplimiento estricto de requisitos regulatorios y de gobernanza corporativa**, con enfoque en un sistema de gestión de riesgos adecuado y cultura de riesgos. 9. **Contribución de liderazgo**, con enfoque en atributos de personas de Allianz: Excelencia en clientes y mercado, liderazgo colaborativo, emprendimiento y confianza; evaluación multi-rater. ### END TABLE

L'entreprise Allianz met en place plusieurs mesures pour fournir et faciliter des recours en cas d'impacts sur les droits de l'homme :

  1. Mécanisme de plainte indépendant : Allianz dispose d'un mécanisme de plainte indépendant appelé SpeakUp@Allianz, où tout le monde, à l'intérieur et à l'extérieur de l'entreprise, peut signaler des problèmes liés aux droits de l'homme des travailleurs dans la chaîne de valeur (Context Num-2, Num-8).

  2. Diligence raisonnable et mesures préventives : Allianz applique des vérifications supplémentaires lors de l'onboarding des fournisseurs, incluant des questions sur leur diligence raisonnable en matière de droits de l'homme, et prend des mesures préventives si des risques liés à des violations des droits de l'homme sont identifiés (Context Num-3, Num-6).

  3. Engagements volontaires et clauses contractuelles : En cas de risques identifiés, Allianz peut engager des discussions avec les entreprises concernées ou ajouter des clauses contractuelles liées aux droits de l'homme dans les accords avec les fournisseurs (Context Num-3).

  4. Recours et actions correctives : Si des violations des droits de l'homme sont identifiées dans la chaîne d'approvisionnement, Allianz cherche à prendre des mesures correctives, en fonction de sa capacité à influencer les fournisseurs, et peut aller jusqu'à rompre la relation avec le fournisseur en dernier recours (Context Num-3).

  5. Évaluations annuelles et ad-hoc : Allianz réalise des évaluations annuelles et ponctuelles des risques pour les droits des employés, et prend des mesures préventives ou correctives si des risques ou violations sont identifiés (Context Num-4).

  • public human rights commitment, see the Allianz Human Rights Policy Statement and the Sustainability Integration Framework . While Allianz has not adopted a dedicated process to engage with value chain workers, human rights issues can be addressed through existing engagement channels. Everyone inside and outside Allianz can report issues related to the human rights of workers in our value chain through our independent complaints mechanism, SpeakUp@ Allianz , which is further detailed in the section G1 Business conduct . In 2024, no severe human rights violations of value chain workers were reported through SpeakUp@Alllianz. Adverse media screenings of potentially high -risk suppliers did not produce any information on human rights violations in our supply chain in 2024. For our insurance and proprietary investment, the ASIS process is designed to prevent Allianz from insuring or investing in public human rights commitment, see the Allianz Human Rights Policy Statement and the Sustainability Integration Framework .   • Human Rights Policy Statement . On the basis of our risk assessments, we have identified the following human rights as the most relevant for our own workforce in the context of our business model: equal treatment, adequate wages, freedom of association and collective bargaining, and occu pational health and safety. For details on our policies, actions, and targets on these specific rights, please refer to the relevant sections of S1 Own workforce and the Allianz company website . Our official global complaints mechanism SpeakUp@ Allianz gives our employees, and everyone else, the opportunity to raise concerns including risks to, and violations of, human rights. The complaints mechanism is widely promoted through the Allianz intranet and other channels, and it forms part of the global training on violation reporting under GCSA. For further information on the channel, please refer to the section Corruption and bribery . Human Rights Policy Statement . On the basis of our risk assessments, we have identified the following human rights as the most relevant for our own workforce in the context of our business model: equal treatment, adequate wages, freedom of association and collective bargaining, and occu pational health and safety. For details on our policies, actions, and targets on these specific rights, please refer to the relevant sections of S1 Own workforce and the Allianz company website . Our official global complaints mechanism SpeakUp@ Allianz gives our employees, and everyone else, the opportunity to raise concerns including risks to, and violations of, human rights. The complaints mechanism is widely promoted through the Allianz intranet and other channels, and it forms part of the global training on violation reporting under GCSA. For further information on the channel, please refer to the section Corruption and bribery .
  • follow their respective definitions and do not aim to meet the definitions of any regulation, including but not limited to Sustainable Finance regulation. Integrating sustainability in own operations We consider human rights as a minimum standard for the treatment of our employees. We conduct annual and ad- hoc assessments of risks to employee rights per the GSCA. If we find risks, we take preventive measures. If we find violations, we remedy them promp tly and effectively (see our Policy Statement on Human Rights). We have implemented measures to minimize risks to human rights and labor standards in our own operations. These include: − The protection of human rights is enshrined in our corporate rules, depending on local laws and requirements. − Anonymous feedback tools and surveys let employees evaluate issues like workload, wages, and diversity. − Extensive measures ensure physical safety and improve health and well -being. follow their respective definitions and do not aim to meet the definitions of any regulation, including but not limited to Sustainable Finance regulation.   • cover topics such as working conditions, equal treatment and opportunities for all, other work -related rights, and child labor and forced labor, including human trafficking. During the supplier onboarding process, suppliers registered in our standard tool for procurement are asked to comply with the VCoC or to submit a comparable code of conduct. For suppliers over a defined threshold, we apply additional checks, including questions on their human rights due diligence. This mitigates the risk of engaging with suppliers who do not uphold human rights standa rds. Additional actions and processes are based on voluntary commitments as well as the requirements of the GSCA . If risks related to violations of human rights of supply chain workers are identified, we take appropriate preventive measures, including, for example, engaging with the companies in question or adding human rights - related contractual clauses to the supplier agreement.   • section Sustainability integration . C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement Annual Report 2024 − Allianz Group 135 S2 Workers in the Value Chain Targets, actions, channels to raise concerns and processes to remediate negative impacts on value chain workers Actions taken and processes implemented by Allianz to assess and address (potential) human rights impacts on value chain workers depend on the stage of the value chain, while they are all guided by the UNGPs. For commercial insurance and non- listed proprietary investments, risk assessments and mitigating actions are governed by the ASIS , while those for our listed proprietary investments are governed by the FRSI , as described above. For the supply chain, risk assessments and mitigating actions are governed by the Allianz Group Standard for Procurement . We track the effectiveness of our actions and processes through the Corporate Rules Book process as described in the section s section Sustainability integration .   • C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement Annual Report 2024 − Allianz Group 146 G1 Business Conduct external channel. Group Compliance runs an annual global awareness campaign to remind employees of the avenues available for reporting. Under the headline SpeakUp@Allianz , our worldwide complaints mechanism has the following features: − It is accessible to Allianz employees, to the employees of Allianz ’s direct and indirect suppliers, and to anyone else who might be impacted by the economic activities of Allianz . − It enables people to draw attention to human rights and environmental risks, as well as violations of human rights or environmental obligations, that have arisen as a result of the economic activities of Allianz or of direct or indirect suppliers. − The Allianz compliance experts responsible for handling the reports submitted through SpeakUp@ Allianz are independent and observe confidentiality rules. C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement Annual Report 2024 − Allianz Group 146 G1 Business Conduct external channel. Group Compliance runs an annual global awareness campaign to remind employees of the avenues available for reporting. Under the headline SpeakUp@Allianz , our worldwide complaints mechanism has the following features: − It is accessible to Allianz employees, to the employees of Allianz ’s direct and indirect suppliers, and to anyone else who might be impacted by the economic activities of Allianz . − It enables people to draw attention to human rights and environmental risks, as well as violations of human rights or environmental obligations, that have arisen as a result of the economic activities of Allianz or of direct or indirect suppliers. − The Allianz compliance experts responsible for handling the reports submitted through SpeakUp@ Allianz are independent and observe confidentiality rules.
  • the reporting person. The Allianz Group has specific procedures in place to ensure that no retaliation measures such as (written) warnings, demotion, dismissal, exclusion from promotions/bonuses, or other disadvantageous measures are taken against whistleblowers, reflecting our commitment to en able a healthy SpeakUp culture within the company. Retaliation measures in any form are not accepted. Reported cases of potential misconduct are treated in strict confidentiality. In the anti- retaliation procedure, the Compliance and HR fu nctions exchange information to the extent necessary to allow identifying any potential measures that could compromise the integrity or objectivity of the investigation procedure and jeopardize whistleblower safeguarding rules. All reported incidents are assessed, documented, and managed following the internal guidelines stipulated in the Allianz Group Compliance Policy , the Allianz Standard for Anti -financial Crime the reporting person. All reported incidents are assessed, documented, and managed following the internal guidelines stipulated in the Allianz Group Compliance Policy , the Allianz Standard for Anti -financial Crime

  • be part of the fossi l fuel value chain. Beyond that, the end -use of fossil fuels is not in scope of this criterion (e.g., combustion engine vehicles or oil-fired heating systems). Thus, the DNSH criterion is automatically fulfilled for retail business, as private use is consi dered as end -use. In our portfolio screening approach, we applied the International Standard of Industrial Classification of economic activities (ISIC codes) to identify insurance policies which are not in line with the DNSH criterion as defined above: The different ISIC co des have been classified as either compliant with DNSH, not compliant with DNSH, or to be assessed on an individual customer level. We have screened our portfolios against this internal classification system. As our commercial risks are allocated to ISIC codes (or comparable national or internal classifications), we could identify insurance policies and revenues which do not comply with DNSH. be part of the fossi l fuel value chain. Beyond that, the end -use of fossil fuels is not in scope of this criterion (e.g., combustion engine vehicles or oil-fired heating systems). Thus, the DNSH criterion is automatically fulfilled for retail business, as private use is consi dered as end -use. In our portfolio screening approach, we applied the International Standard of Industrial Classification of economic activities (ISIC codes) to identify insurance policies which are not in line with the DNSH criterion as defined above: The different ISIC co des have been classified as either compliant with DNSH, not compliant with DNSH, or to be assessed on an individual customer level. We have screened our portfolios against this internal classification system. As our commercial risks are allocated to ISIC codes (or comparable national or internal classifications), we could identify insurance policies and revenues which do not comply with DNSH.
  • purposes. However, we continue to monitor the evolution of the Taxonomy Regulation to cover further sectors of the economy and become a tool for portfolio steering in th e future. In addition, as part of the 2024 Taxonomy reporting, Allianz is required to disclose its exposure to the six nuclear and gas activities stipulated in the Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2022/ 1214 ( Annex III). This disclosure seeks to elicit the portion of aligned investments that are a result of the stated activities. For 2024, Allianz ’s exposure to nuclear and gas activities is considered very small (around 3 % of aligned assets for turnover and CAPEX based on total alignment figures). The eligible tu rnover based exposure of all other objectives beside climate change is around 2 % in 2024. Allianz took the decision to de -scope third- party asset management purposes. However, we continue to monitor the evolution of the Taxonomy Regulation to cover further sectors of the economy and become a tool for portfolio steering in th e future. In addition, as part of the 2024 Taxonomy reporting, Allianz is required to disclose its exposure to the six nuclear and gas activities stipulated in the Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2022/ 1214 ( Annex III). This disclosure seeks to elicit the portion of aligned investments that are a result of the stated activities. For 2024, Allianz ’s exposure to nuclear and gas activities is considered very small (around 3 % of aligned assets for turnover and CAPEX based on total alignment figures). The eligible tu rnover based exposure of all other objectives beside climate change is around 2 % in 2024. Allianz took the decision to de -scope third- party asset management
S1-21

L'entreprise publie-t-elle des informations sur l'alignement de ses politiques en matière de main-d'œuvre avec les instruments internationaux pertinents, y compris les principes directeurs des Nations Unies relatifs aux entreprises et aux droits de l'homme ?

nan

Oui, l'entreprise publie des informations sur l'alignement de ses politiques en matière de main-d'œuvre avec les instruments internationaux pertinents. Par exemple, dans le contexte fourni, les politiques de diligence raisonnable d'Allianz se conforment aux principes directeurs des Nations Unies relatifs aux entreprises et aux droits de l'homme (UNGP) et aux lignes directrices de l'OCDE. Ces politiques sont également alignées avec les conventions fondamentales de l'Organisation internationale du travail (OIT) et le German Supply Chain Due Diligence Act (GSCA). Ces engagements sont détaillés dans les sections S1 "Own workforce" et S2 "Workers in the value chain".


Afficher les sourcesLLM
Sources LLM :
  • Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les exigences de divulgation et les points de données associés, classés par leur matérialité ("matériel", "non matériel" ou "non pertinent") et leurs sous-sections ou sous-sous-sections. Les exigences matérielles incluent : 1. **ESRS S2-1** : Non-respect des principes des UNGPs et des lignes directrices de l'OCDE (paragraphe 19) et politiques de diligence raisonnable liées aux conventions fondamentales de l'OIT (1 à 8, paragraphe 19), dans les sous-sections "politiques Allianz ESRS" et "stratégie et modèle d'affaires liés aux travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur". 2. **ESRS S2-4** : Questions et incidents relatifs aux droits humains dans la chaîne de valeur (paragraphe 36), avec des cibles, actions et processus pour remédier aux impacts négatifs. 3. **ESRS S3-1** : Engagements politiques en matière de droits humains (paragraphe 16) et non-respect des principes des UNGPs, de l'OIT ou de l'OCDE (paragraphe 17), dans le cadre de la stratégie et du modèle d'affaires liés aux communautés affectées. 4. **ESRS S3-4** : Questions et incidents relatifs aux droits humains (paragraphe 36), avec des actions et processus d'engagement avec les communautés affectées. 5. **ESRS S4-4** : Questions et incidents relatifs aux droits humains (paragraphe 35), avec des actions. 6. **ESRS G1-4** : Incidents confirmés de corruption ou de pots-de-vin (paragraphes 24 (a) et (b)). Les points non matériels ou non pertinents incluent : - **ESRS S4-1** : Politiques liées aux consommateurs et utilisateurs finaux (paragraphes 16 et 17), jugées non applicables. - **ESRS G1-1** : Convention des Nations Unies contre la corruption (paragraphe 10 (b)) et protection des lanceurs d'alerte (paragraphe 10 (d)), avec des politiques déjà en place. and

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les exigences de divulgation liées à divers aspects des droits humains, de la corruption et des politiques de diligence raisonnable. Il indique si ces exigences sont considérées comme "matérielles", "non matérielles" ou "non pertinentes", et précise les sous-sections ou sous-sous-sections associées. Les points matériels incluent des politiques et des actions liées aux droits humains, aux travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur, aux communautés affectées, ainsi qu'aux incidents confirmés de corruption ou de pots-de-vin. Les points non matériels ou non pertinents concernent principalement les politiques déjà en place ou les aspects jugés non applicables.

  • Le tableau présente une liste de sujets de durabilité, des exigences de divulgation associées, des sections correspondantes et des sous-sections ou sous-sous-sections détaillant les aspects spécifiques à traiter. Les sujets incluent "E4 Biodiversity and ecosystems", "E5 Resource use and circular economy" et "S1 Own workforce". Pour "E4 Biodiversity and ecosystems", les sous-sections couvrent la stratégie et le modèle d'affaires, la matérialité, les politiques, les actions et les objectifs liés à la biodiversité et aux écosystèmes. Pour "E5 Resource use and circular economy", les sous-sections incluent la matérialité, les politiques, les actions, les objectifs et les métriques, telles que l'influx de ressources et les déchets électroniques. Concernant "S1 Own workforce", les sous-sections abordent la stratégie "Group People and Culture", la matérialité, les politiques, l'engagement, les processus pour soulever des préoccupations, les actions, les objectifs, les caractéristiques des employés, la négociation collective, le genre, les générations, les salaires adéquats, la protection sociale, les personnes handicapées, l'apprentissage et le développement, la santé et la sécurité, l'équilibre travail-vie personnelle, l'écart de rémunération entre les sexes et les droits humains. Chaque sujet est structuré pour analyser les impacts, les risques et les opportunités liés à ces domaines. and

    S1 Own workforce S1-13 S1 Own workforce Learning and development and performance management
    S1 Own workforce S1-14 S1 Own workforce Health and safety
    S1 Own workforce S1-15 S1 Own workforce Work-life balance
    S1 Own workforce S1-16 S1 Own workforce Gender pay gap and remuneration ratio
    S1 Own workforce S1-17 S1 Own workforce Human rights in own workforce

    Le tableau présente une liste de sujets de durabilité, des exigences de divulgation associées, des sections correspondantes et des sous-sections ou sous-sous-sections détaillant les aspects spécifiques à traiter. Les sujets abordés incluent la biodiversité et les écosystèmes, l'utilisation des ressources et l'économie circulaire, ainsi que la gestion de la main-d'œuvre propre. Chaque sujet est divisé en plusieurs catégories, telles que la stratégie, la matérialité, les politiques, les actions, les objectifs, et les métriques, afin de fournir une vue complète des impacts, des risques et des opportunités liés à ces domaines.

  • Le tableau présente des données sur les droits humains et la main-d'œuvre propre pour les années 2024 et 2023. Les colonnes incluent "Description", "Unité", "2024" et "2023". Les lignes sont : "Nombre de plaintes déposées par les employés via le mécanisme officiel de plaintes Allianz", "Nombre de plaintes déposées auprès des Points de Contact Nationaux pour les Entreprises Multinationales de l'OCDE", "Nombre d'incidents de discrimination, y compris le harcèlement", "Nombre d'incidents graves relatifs aux droits humains concernant la main-d'œuvre propre", et "Montant des amendes matérielles, pénalités et compensations pour incidents liés à la main-d'œuvre propre". En 2024, 388 plaintes ont été déposées via le mécanisme officiel de plaintes Allianz, et 31 incidents de discrimination, y compris le harcèlement, ont été signalés. Aucun incident grave relatif aux droits humains ou montant d'amendes n'a été enregistré pour cette année. Les données pour 2023 ne sont pas disponibles (n.a.). and

    BEGIN TABLE

    Description Unité 2024 2023
    Nombre de plaintes déposées par les employés via le mécanisme officiel de plaintes Allianz # 388 n.a.
    Nombre de plaintes déposées auprès des Points de Contact Nationaux pour les Entreprises Multinationales de l'OCDE # - n.a.
    Nombre d'incidents de discrimination, y compris le harcèlement # 31 n.a.
    Nombre d'incidents graves relatifs aux droits humains concernant la main-d'œuvre propre # - n.a.
    Montant des amendes matérielles, pénalités et compensations pour incidents liés à la main-d'œuvre propre € mille - n.a.

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente des données sur les plaintes, incidents et amendes liés aux droits humains et à la main-d'œuvre propre pour les années 2024 et 2023. En 2024, 388 plaintes ont été déposées via le mécanisme officiel de plaintes Allianz, et 31 incidents de discrimination, y compris le harcèlement, ont été signalés. Aucun incident grave relatif aux droits humains ou montant d'amendes n'a été enregistré pour cette année. Les données pour 2023 ne sont pas disponibles (n.a.).

  • Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau détaille les exigences de divulgation pour diverses matières de durabilité, organisées par "Sustainability matter", "Disclosure requirements", "Section" et "Sub-section/sub-sub-section". Les principales catégories incluent : 1. **Workers in the value chain** : Exigences S2 SBM-2 à S2-5, couvrant la stratégie, la matérialité, les politiques, les objectifs, les actions, et les processus pour remédier aux impacts négatifs sur les travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur. 2. **Affected communities** : Exigences S3 SBM-2 à S3-5, abordant la stratégie, la matérialité, les politiques, les objectifs, et les processus pour engager les communautés affectées. 3. **Consumers and end-users** : Exigences S4 SBM-2 à S4-5, incluant la stratégie, la matérialité, les politiques, l'engagement, les actions, et les objectifs liés aux consommateurs et utilisateurs finaux. 4. **Sustainability Strategy and Governance** : Exigence G1 GOV-1, portant sur le rôle des organes administratifs, de gestion et de supervision. 5. **Materiality** : Exigence G1 IRO-1, décrivant le processus d'identification et d'évaluation des impacts et opportunités matériels. 6. **Business conduct** : Exigences G1-1 à G1-5, couvrant la culture d'entreprise, la gestion des relations avec les fournisseurs, la prévention et détection de la corruption, les incidents confirmés de corruption, et les activités d'influence politique et de lobbying. Chaque catégorie est associée à des sous-sections spécifiques, mettant en avant les politiques, objectifs, actions, et processus pertinents. and

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les exigences de divulgation liées à différents aspects de la durabilité, classées par matière de durabilité, section et sous-section. Les principales catégories incluent les travailleurs dans la chaîne de valeur, les communautés affectées, les consommateurs et utilisateurs finaux, la stratégie et gouvernance de durabilité, la matérialité, et la conduite des affaires. Chaque catégorie est associée à des sous-sections spécifiques, telles que les politiques, les objectifs, les actions, les processus pour soulever des préoccupations, et les modèles stratégiques. Les informations couvrent des sujets variés, allant de la gestion des relations avec les fournisseurs à la prévention de la corruption et des activités de lobbying.

  • Allianz aims to identify, prevent, mitigate or remediate adverse human rights impacts linked to its business activities and operations, including our supply chain. Our approach is guided by the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises and the U.N. Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights (UNGP). Our due diligence in own operations and supply chains complies with the German Supply Chain Due Diligence Act (GSCA) and is covered by the Allianz SE Human Rights Policy Statement. Please refer to the sections S1 Own workforce and S2 Workers in the value chain for further details. Our due diligence process for proprietary investments and commercial insurance can be found in the sections S2 Workers in the value chain and S3 Affected communities of this report. Allianz aims to identify, prevent, mitigate or remediate adverse human rights impacts linked to its business activities and operations, including our supply chain. Our approach is guided by the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises and the U.N. Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights (UNGP). Our due diligence in own operations and supply chains complies with the German Supply Chain Due Diligence Act (GSCA) and is covered by the Allianz SE Human Rights Policy Statement. Please refer to the sections S1 Own workforce and S2 Workers in the value chain for further details. Our due diligence process for proprietary investments and commercial insurance can be found in the sections S2 Workers in the value chain and S3 Affected communities of this report.
  • C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement — — the International Bill of Human Rights, comprising the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights, and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights and its two Optional Protocols, in addition to the core International Labor Organization (ILO) Conventions, comprising the prohibition of child labor and forced labor, freedom of association and the right to collective bargaining, occupational health and safety, and the elimination of discrimination in respect of employment and occupation. C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement — — the International Bill of Human Rights, comprising the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights, and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights and its two Optional Protocols, in addition to the core International Labor Organization (ILO) Conventions, comprising the prohibition of child labor and forced labor, freedom of association and the right to collective bargaining, occupational health and safety, and the elimination of discrimination in respect of employment and occupation.
  • Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau détaille les "exigences de divulgation et points de données associés", leur "matérialité" (matériel ou non matériel), et les "sous-sections/sous-sous-sections" correspondantes. Les points matériels incluent : 1. **ESRS E4-2** : Politiques sur les océans/mer et la déforestation, liées à la biodiversité et aux écosystèmes. 2. **ESRS E5-5** : Déchets non recyclés et dangereux, liés à l'économie circulaire et à l'utilisation des ressources. 3. **ESRS S1-1** : Engagements en matière de droits humains, politiques de diligence raisonnable, prévention des accidents, et mécanismes de gestion des plaintes, liés à la main-d'œuvre propre. 4. **ESRS S1-14** : Santé et sécurité, incluant les accidents et jours perdus. 5. **ESRS S1-16** : Écarts de rémunération entre genres et ratios de rémunération. 6. **ESRS S1-17** : Incidents de discrimination et non-respect des principes directeurs de l'ONU et des lignes directrices de l'OCDE, liés aux droits humains dans la main-d'œuvre propre. 7. **ESRS 2-SBM-3 - S2** : Risques significatifs de travail des enfants ou forcé dans la chaîne de valeur. 8. **ESRS S2-1** : Engagements en matière de droits humains pour les travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur. Les points non matériels incluent les risques d'incidents de travail forcé ou des enfants (ESRS 2-SBM-3 - S1) et les mesures contre la traite humaine (ESRS S1-1). and

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les exigences de divulgation et les points de données associés, leur matérialité (matériel ou non matériel), ainsi que les sous-sections ou sous-sous-sections correspondantes. Les points de données matériels concernent principalement les politiques liées à la biodiversité, l'économie circulaire, la sécurité au travail, les droits humains, les mécanismes de gestion des plaintes, et les écarts de rémunération. Les points non matériels sont considérés comme non applicables.

  • Résumé du tableau : Le tableau présente les politiques d'Allianz en lien avec les normes ESRS, à savoir l'Allianz Standard for Integration of Sustainability (ASIS), l'Allianz Group Risk Policy (GRP) et l'Allianz Standard for P&C Underwriting (ASU). Ces politiques font partie du livre des règles d'entreprise d'Allianz et couvrent les dimensions de la chaîne de valeur telles que l'assurance, les investissements propriétaires, la gestion d'actifs et les opérations internes. Les politiques abordent des enjeux de durabilité identifiés comme matériels, notamment : E1 Changement climatique (atténuation et adaptation), E2 Pollution, E3 Ressources en eau et marines, E4 Biodiversité et écosystèmes, E5 Utilisation des ressources et économie circulaire, S1 Main-d'œuvre propre, S2 Travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur, S3 Communautés affectées, S4 Consommateurs et utilisateurs finaux, et G1 Conduite des affaires. Chaque politique est associée à des sections spécifiques dans la déclaration de durabilité d'Allianz, telles que : "Allianz Standard for Integration of Sustainability (ASIS)", "Climate Change Strategy and Net-Zero Transition", "Policies related to pollution", "Policies related to water and marine resources", "Policies related to biodiversity and ecosystems", "Policies related to resource use and circular economy", "Policies related to workers in the value chain", "Policies related to affected communities", "Allianz Group Risk Policy (GRP)", "Allianz Standard for P&C Underwriting (ASU)", "Policies related to climate change mitigation for our insurance portfolio", et "Policies related to climate change adaptation for our insurance portfolio". and

    Résumé du tableau : Le tableau présente trois politiques d'Allianz en lien avec les normes ESRS : ASIS, GRP et ASU. Ces politiques sont intégrées dans le livre des règles d'entreprise d'Allianz et couvrent différentes dimensions de la chaîne de valeur, notamment l'assurance, les investissements propriétaires, la gestion d'actifs et les opérations internes. Les politiques abordent divers enjeux de durabilité, tels que le changement climatique, la pollution, les ressources en eau et marines, la biodiversité, l'économie circulaire, les travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur, les communautés affectées, les consommateurs et la conduite des affaires. Chaque politique est également associée à des sections spécifiques dans la déclaration de durabilité d'Allianz.

  • ### Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les ratios et les montants monétaires relatifs aux actifs couverts par les indicateurs clés de performance (KPI) en pourcentage et en milliards d'euros (€ bn). Les informations incluent : - Les ratios pour le chiffre d'affaires ("Turnover", 2.1%) et les dépenses d'investissement ("CAPEX", 2.3%). - La valeur monétaire des actifs couverts par le KPI ("Monetary value of assets covered by the KPI", 71.5 € bn). - La valeur des dérivés ("Value in monetary amounts of derivatives", 3.0 € bn). - Les expositions aux entreprises financières et non financières non soumises aux articles 19a et 29a de la Directive 2013/34/EU, avec 29.2 € bn pour les entreprises non financières et 16.7 € bn pour les entreprises financières. - Les expositions aux entreprises financières et non financières de pays hors UE non soumises aux articles 19a et 29a de la Directive 2013/34/EU, avec 22.8 € bn pour les entreprises non financières et 10.2 € bn pour les entreprises financières. - Les expositions aux entreprises financières et non financières soumises aux articles 19a et 29a de la Directive 2013/34/EU, avec 9.9 € bn pour les entreprises non financières et 28.5 € bn pour les entreprises financières. - Les expositions à d'autres contreparties et actifs ("Value of exposures to other counterparties and assets", 12.6 € bn). - Les investissements des entreprises d'assurance ou de réassurance autres que ceux liés aux contrats d'assurance vie où le risque est supporté par les assurés ("Value of insurance or reinsurance undertaking’s investments other than investments held in respect of life insurance contracts where the investment risk is borne by the policy holders", 81.4 € bn). - Les investissements finançant des activités économiques non éligibles à la taxonomie, avec des ratios de 31.1% pour le chiffre d'affaires et 30.5% pour les CAPEX. - Les investissements finançant des activités économiques éligibles à la taxonomie mais non alignées, avec des ratios de 17.8% pour le chiffre d'affaires et 18.3% pour les CAPEX. and

    For financial undertakings 28.5

L'entreprise publie des informations sur l'alignement de ses politiques en matière de main-d'œuvre avec les instruments internationaux pertinents. Les documents mentionnent que les politiques de diligence raisonnable de l'entreprise, notamment concernant les droits de l'homme, sont alignées avec les principes directeurs des Nations Unies relatifs aux entreprises et aux droits de l'homme (UNGPs) et les lignes directrices de l'OCDE pour les entreprises multinationales. Ces engagements sont pris en compte tant pour les travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur (contextes Num-3 et Num-7) que pour les opérations internes (contextes Num-6 et Num-8).

  • # Integrating Sustainability in Own Operations We consider human rights as a minimum standard for the treatment of our employees. We conduct annual and ad-hoc assessments of risks to employee rights per the GSCA. If we find risks, we take preventive measures. If we find violations, we remedy them promptly and effectively (see our [Policy Statement on Human Rights](URL)). We have implemented measures to minimize risks to human rights and labor standards in our own operations. These include: - The protection of human rights is enshrined in our corporate rules, depending on local laws and requirements. - Anonymous feedback tools and surveys let employees evaluate issues like workload, wages, and diversity. - Extensive measures ensure physical safety and improve health and well-being. - Training in sustainability-related issues, including equal treatment and occupational health & safety, at Group and subsidiary levels. # Integrating Sustainability in Own Operations We consider human rights as a minimum standard for the treatment of our employees. We conduct annual and ad-hoc assessments of risks to employee rights per the GSCA. If we find risks, we take preventive measures. If we find violations, we remedy them promptly and effectively (see our [Policy Statement on Human Rights](URL)). We have implemented measures to minimize risks to human rights and labor standards in our own operations. These include: - The protection of human rights is enshrined in our corporate rules, depending on local laws and requirements. - Anonymous feedback tools and surveys let employees evaluate issues like workload, wages, and diversity. - Extensive measures ensure physical safety and improve health and well-being. - Training in sustainability-related issues, including equal treatment and occupational health & safety, at Group and subsidiary levels.

Our due diligence processes in own operations comply with the requirements of the GSCA, aligned with the UNGPs. For further information, please refer to the sections [Integrating sustainability in Allianz own operations](#), [Collective bargaining coverage and social dialogue](#), and [Human rights in own workforce](#). human rights as outlined in the International Bill of Human Rights and the core International Labor Organization Convention. Our due diligence processes in own operations comply with the requirements of the GSCA, aligned with the UNGPs. For further information, please refer to the sections [Integrating sustainability in Allianz own operations](#), [Collective bargaining coverage and social dialogue](#), and [Human rights in own workforce](#).
  • ### Strategy and business model related to workers in the value chain Allianz is committed to supporting and respecting the protection of international human rights, as well as ensuring it is not complicit in the abuse of human rights, as outlined in the International Bill of Rights and the ILO Core Conventions. This commitment also applies to our value chain. Allianz's due diligence approach to identify, prevent, and mitigate adverse human rights impacts linked to business activities has been guided by the OECD Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises and the UNGPs. As a multinational insurance and asset management company, our value chain encompasses workers at: - Allianz suppliers, - companies insured by Allianz, - companies that Allianz invests in as part of its proprietary investments, and - our tied agents responsible for distributing our products. ### Strategy and business model related to workers in the value chain Allianz is committed to supporting and respecting the protection of international human rights, as well as ensuring it is not complicit in the abuse of human rights, as outlined in the International Bill of Rights and the ILO Core Conventions. This commitment also applies to our value chain. Allianz's due diligence approach to identify, prevent, and mitigate adverse human rights impacts linked to business activities has been guided by the OECD Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises and the UNGPs. As a multinational insurance and asset management company, our value chain encompasses workers at: - Allianz suppliers, - companies insured by Allianz, - companies that Allianz invests in as part of its proprietary investments, and - our tied agents responsible for distributing our products.
  • ## Allianz SE Human Rights Policy Statement Please refer to the sections S1 Own workforce and S2 Workers in the value chain for further details. Our due diligence process for proprietary investments and commercial insurance can be found in the sections S2 Workers in the value chain and S3 Affected communities of this report. At Allianz, sustainability is viewed as a journey across a dynamic and constantly evolving landscape. As such, we embrace the role of a learning organization. We acknowledge the ongoing enhancements of our impact, risk, and opportunity assessments as the maturity and availability of data, external credible sources, and independent standards continue to evolve, enabling us to effectively address the challenges of sustainability. ## Allianz SE Human Rights Policy Statement Please refer to the sections S1 Own workforce and S2 Workers in the value chain for further details. Our due diligence process for proprietary investments and commercial insurance can be found in the sections S2 Workers in the value chain and S3 Affected communities of this report. At Allianz, sustainability is viewed as a journey across a dynamic and constantly evolving landscape. As such, we embrace the role of a learning organization. We acknowledge the ongoing enhancements of our impact, risk, and opportunity assessments as the maturity and availability of data, external credible sources, and independent standards continue to evolve, enabling us to effectively address the challenges of sustainability.
  • ## Determination of (retro-)ceded premium share For natural catastrophe events, Allianz Group subsidiaries transfer a portion of their business and associated risks to Allianz SE Reinsurance through internal reinsurance agreements. Allianz SE Reinsurance pools this business and, along with the net retained business of these local entities, manages the risk using external reinsurance purchased centrally on behalf of Allianz SE. 115 --- --- #### The underwriting KPI for non-life insurance and reinsurance undertakings ### BEGIN TABLE | Economic activities | Substantial contribution to climate change adaptation | DNSH (Do Not Significant Harm) | |-------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------| | | Absolute premiums 2024 (c mn) | Proportion of premiums 2024 (%) | Proportion of premiums 2023 (%) | Climate change mitigation (Y/N) | Water and marine resources (Y/N) | Circular economy (Y/N) | Pollution (Y/N) | Biodiversity and ecosystems (Y/N) | Minimum safeguards (Y/N) | | A.1.   • ### Percentage of energy consumption covered by unbundled contractual instruments This refers to EACs as defined above, for which a percentage will be disclosed. The percentage is disclosed every year, reflecting the reported consumption data covered by unbundled instruments (EACs). All energy consumption is included in the analysis (e.g., heating, electricity). ### Percentage of energy consumption covered by unbundled contractual instruments This refers to EACs as defined above, for which a percentage will be disclosed. The percentage is disclosed every year, reflecting the reported consumption data covered by unbundled instruments (EACs). All energy consumption is included in the analysis (e.g., heating, electricity).
  • ### END TABLE ¹ Principles for Sustainable Insurance – United Nations Environment – Finance Initiative. --- --- ### END TABLE ¹ Principles for Sustainable Insurance – United Nations Environment – Finance Initiative. --- ---

Oui, l'entreprise publie des informations sur l'alignement de ses politiques en matière de main-d'œuvre avec les instruments internationaux pertinents, y compris les Principes directeurs des Nations Unies relatifs aux entreprises et aux droits de l'homme (UNGP). Selon le contexte fourni, Allianz s'engage à respecter les droits de l'homme tels qu'énoncés dans la Déclaration universelle des droits de l'homme et les conventions fondamentales de l'Organisation internationale du travail (OIT). De plus, leur processus de diligence raisonnable est conforme aux obligations légales de la loi allemande sur la diligence raisonnable dans les chaînes d'approvisionnement (GSCA) et est couvert par la déclaration de politique des droits de l'homme d'Allianz SE.


Afficher les sources Pypdf
Sources Pypdf :
  • ### Integrating sustainability in own operations We consider human rights as a minimum standard for the treatment of our employees. We conduct annual and ad-hoc assessments of risks to employee rights per the GSCA. If we find risks, we take preventive measures. If we find violations, we remedy them promptly and effectively (see our Policy Statement on Human Rights). We have implemented measures to minimize risks to human rights and labor standards in our own operations. These include: - The protection of human rights is enshrined in our corporate rules, depending on local laws and requirements. - Anonymous feedback tools and surveys let employees evaluate issues like workload, wages, and diversity. - Extensive measures ensure physical safety and improve health and well-being. - Training in sustainability-related issues, including equal treatment and occupational health & safety, at Group and subsidiary levels.
  • Allianz aims to identify, prevent, mitigate or remediate adverse human rights impacts linked to its business activities and operations, including our supply chain. Our approach is guided by the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises and the U.N. Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights (UNGP). Our due diligence in own operations and supply chains complies with the legal obligations of the German Supply Chain Due Diligence Act (GSCA) and is covered by the Allianz SE Human Rights Policy Statement. Please refer to the sections S1 Own workforce and S2 Workers in the value chain for further details. Our due diligence process for proprietary investments and commercial insurance can be found in the sections S2 Workers in the value chain and S3 Affected communities of this report.
  • ### Strategy and business model related to workers in the value chain Allianz is committed to supporting and respecting the protection of international human rights, as well as ensuring it is not complicit in the abuse of human rights, as outlined in the International Bill of Rights and the ILO Core Conventions. This commitment also applies to our value chain. Allianz's due diligence approach to identify, prevent, and mitigate adverse human rights impacts linked to business activities has been guided by the OECD Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises and the UNGPs. As a multinational insurance and asset management company, our value chain encompasses workers at: - Allianz suppliers, - companies insured by Allianz, - companies that Allianz invests in as part of its proprietary investments, and - our tied agents responsible for distributing our products.
  • # --- Page 79 --- ## C_ Group Management Report_ Sustainability Statement ### Human rights in own workforce Allianz recognizes the importance of human rights as both a value- based and a business issue. We see respect for human rights as a minimum standard for responsible business, both within and beyond our direct operations. For further information on our human rights commitment see our Human Rights Policy Statement.
  • Rule for Human Rights Due Diligence in Own Operations reflects our further obligations to manage risks to the human rights of our employees, including equal treatment, occupational health and safety, freedom of association, and living wages, as well as the prohibition of child and forced labor. Employees are treated equally, regardless of national or ethnic origin, social origin, health status, disability, sexual orientation, age, gender, religious beliefs, or any other protected characteristic. The Allianz Functional Rule for Human Rights Due Diligence in Own Operations applies to the entire Allianz Group except for certain subsidiaries, which are covered by separate standards aligned with the general principles. We support and respect international human rights as outlined in the International Bill of Human Rights and the core International Labor Organization Convention. Our due diligence processes in own operations comply with the requirements of the GSCA, aligned with the UNGPs.
  • # --- Page 83 --- ## C_ Group Management Report_ Sustainability Statement ### Targets, actions, channels to raise concerns and processes to remediate negative impacts on value chain workers Actions taken and processes implemented by Allianz to assess and address (potential) human rights impacts on value chain workers depend on the stage of the value chain, while they are all guided by the UNGPs.
  • ### Policies related to workers in the value chain At Allianz, we address the management of material impacts on value chain workers through targeted due diligence processes with our business partners. An integral part of our due diligence processes across the value chain is due diligence on forced labor and child labor. In the event of identifying risks and issues, we may initiate engagement or make the decision not to collaborate with these business partners. These processes and actions are governed by different policies, depending on the specific value chain component. For our human rights commitment across the value chain, please refer to our Human Rights Policy Statement.
  • # --- Page 5 --- ### C_ Group Management Report_ Sustainability Statement - the International Bill of Human Rights, comprising the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights, and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights and its two Optional Protocols, in addition to - the core International Labor Organization (ILO) Conventions, comprising the prohibition of child labor and forced labor, freedom of association and the right to collective bargaining, occupational health and safety, and the elimination of discrimination in respect of employment and occupation.
  • ### BEGIN TABLE La tabla presenta datos sobre la intensidad de gases de efecto invernadero (GHG) y el volumen total de negocios de Allianz Group al 31 de diciembre de 2024 y 2023. - **Etiquetas de columnas**: "0", "1", "2", "3". - **Etiquetas de filas**: "As of 31 December", "Total business volume1", "Total GHG emissions (market-based)2", "GHG intensity (market-based)", "Total GHG emissions (location-based)2", "GHG intensity (location-based)". - **Años**: 2024 y 2023. **Datos clave**: 1. El volumen total de negocios ("Total business volume1") fue de **179,777.8 mn €** en 2024 y **161,700.0 mn €** en 2023. 2. Las emisiones totales de GHG basadas en el mercado ("Total GHG emissions (market-based)2") fueron de **48,932,692.3 t en CO2e** en 2024 y **57,562,291.4 t en CO2e** en 2023. 3. La intensidad de GHG basada en el mercado ("GHG intensity (market-based)") fue de **272.2 t en CO2e/€ mn** en 2024 y **356.0 t en CO2e/€ mn** en 2023. 4. Las emisiones totales de GHG basadas en la ubicación ("Total GHG emissions (location-based)2") fueron de **49,067,050.4 t en CO2e** en 2024 y **57,688,706.5 t en CO2e** en 2023. 5. La intensidad de GHG basada en la ubicación ("GHG intensity (location-based)") fue de **272.9 t en CO2e/€ mn** en 2024 y **356.8 t en CO2e/€ mn** en 2023. ### END TABLE

  • ### BEGIN TABLE La tabla presenta los KPI/targets para el año 2025, con un objetivo del 100 %. Los indicadores incluyen: 1. **Reducción de emisiones propias en inversiones**: Emisiones absolutas financiadas de GHG en millones de toneladas de CO2e provenientes de corporaciones listadas, con un objetivo de **12.3 mn t CO2e**. 2. **Digital Net Promoter Score (dNPS)**: Porcentaje de líderes de lealtad en segmentos de negocio, con un objetivo de **50 %**. 3. **Inclusive Meritocracy Index (IMIX)**: Desarrollo contra el nivel de ambición general, con un objetivo de **77 %**. 4. **Plan de transición hacia compromisos de cero emisiones netas**: Incluye reducción de emisiones en el sector de motor retail y reducción de intensidad de emisiones en el sector comercial de Property-Casualty. 5. **Soluciones sostenibles en Property-Casualty**. 6. **Desarrollo del Digital Net Promoter Score (dNPS)** contra el nivel de ambición general. 7. **Desarrollo del Inclusive Meritocracy Index (IMIX)** contra el nivel de ambición general. 8. **Cumplimiento estricto de requisitos regulatorios y de gobernanza corporativa**, con enfoque en un sistema de gestión de riesgos adecuado y cultura de riesgos. 9. **Contribución de liderazgo**, con enfoque en atributos de personas de Allianz: Excelencia en clientes y mercado, liderazgo colaborativo, emprendimiento y confianza; evaluación multi-rater. ### END TABLE
  • ### BEGIN TABLE La tabla presenta los requisitos de divulgación y puntos de datos relacionados, clasificados por "Materiality" y "Sub-section/sub-sub-section". Los años no están especificados en el contenido. 1. **ESRS S2-1** aborda el incumplimiento de los principios de los UNGPs sobre Empresas y Derechos Humanos y las directrices de la OCDE (párrafo 19), así como las políticas de diligencia debida relacionadas con los convenios fundamentales de la OIT (párrafo 19). Ambos son materiales y se relacionan con las políticas de ESRS y el modelo de negocio estratégico para los trabajadores en la cadena de valor. 2. **ESRS S2-4** trata temas de derechos humanos e incidentes en la cadena de valor (párrafo 36), considerado material, con enfoque en objetivos, acciones, canales para plantear preocupaciones y procesos para remediar impactos negativos. 3. **ESRS S3-1** incluye compromisos de políticas de derechos humanos (párrafo 16) y el incumplimiento de principios de UNGPs, OIT u OCDE (párrafo 17), ambos materiales y vinculados al modelo de negocio estratégico para comunidades afectadas. 4. **ESRS S3-4** aborda temas e incidentes de derechos humanos (párrafo 36), considerado material, con enfoque en objetivos, acciones, canales para plantear preocupaciones y procesos de interacción con comunidades afectadas. 5. **ESRS S4-1** sobre políticas relacionadas con consumidores y usuarios finales (párrafo 16) y el incumplimiento de principios de UNGPs y OCDE (párrafo 17) no son materiales. 6. **ESRS S4-4** aborda temas e incidentes de derechos humanos (párrafo 35), considerado material, con enfoque en acciones. 7. **ESRS G1-1** sobre la Convención de las Naciones Unidas contra la Corrupción (párrafo 10 (b)) y la protección de denunciantes (párrafo 10 (d)) no son relevantes, ya que las políticas ya están implementadas. 8. **ESRS G1-4** sobre multas por violación de leyes anticorrupción y antirrobo (párrafo 24 (a)) y estándares anticorrupción y antirrobo (párrafo 24 (b)) son materiales, con enfoque en incidentes confirmados de corrupción o soborno. 9. Se menciona la aplicación de la cláusula de salvaguarda según ESRS 2.5(e) en relación con §§ 289e y 315c HGB para la brecha salarial de género en S1-16, sin más detalles.

Oui, l'entreprise publie des informations sur l'alignement de ses politiques en matière de main-d'œuvre avec des instruments internationaux pertinents. Allianz s'engage à soutenir et respecter la protection des droits humains internationaux, conformément aux principes directeurs des Nations Unies relatifs aux entreprises et aux droits de l'homme (UNGP), ainsi qu'aux conventions fondamentales de l'Organisation internationale du travail (OIT) et aux directives de l'Organisation de coopération et de développement économiques (OCDE) pour les entreprises multinationales.
