    ```markdown
    Allianz Group Compliance Manual Yes Allianz own operations Material impacts and risks in G1 Business conduct Corruption and bribery
    Allianz Vendor Code of Conduct Yes Allianz own operations Material impacts and risks in G1 Business conduct Management of relationship with suppliers
    Allianz Sustainable Procurement Charter Yes Allianz own operations Material impacts and risks related to Allianz suppliers, S2 Workers in the value chain Management of relationship with suppliers

    ```
    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les politiques d'Allianz en lien avec les normes ESRS, leur inclusion dans le livre des règles d'Allianz, leur dimension dans la chaîne de valeur, les enjeux de durabilité qu'elles adressent, et les sections correspondantes dans la déclaration de durabilité. Les politiques couvrent divers domaines tels que les investissements, les opérations internes, la gestion des actifs, la protection des clients, la conformité, et les droits humains. Elles abordent des impacts matériels liés au changement climatique, à la pollution, à la biodiversité, à l'économie circulaire, aux travailleurs dans la chaîne de valeur, aux communautés affectées, et à la conduite des affaires.

  • Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau détaille les exigences de divulgation pour diverses matières de durabilité, organisées par "Sustainability matter", "Disclosure requirements", "Section" et "Sub-section/sub-sub-section". Les principales catégories incluent : 1. **Workers in the value chain** : Exigences S2 SBM-2 à S2-5, couvrant la stratégie, la matérialité, les politiques, les objectifs, les actions, et les processus pour remédier aux impacts négatifs sur les travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur. 2. **Affected communities** : Exigences S3 SBM-2 à S3-5, abordant la stratégie, la matérialité, les politiques, les objectifs, et les processus pour engager les communautés affectées. 3. **Consumers and end-users** : Exigences S4 SBM-2 à S4-5, incluant la stratégie, la matérialité, les politiques, l'engagement, les actions, et les objectifs liés aux consommateurs et utilisateurs finaux. 4. **Sustainability Strategy and Governance** : Exigence G1 GOV-1, portant sur le rôle des organes administratifs, de gestion et de supervision. 5. **Materiality** : Exigence G1 IRO-1, décrivant le processus d'identification et d'évaluation des impacts et opportunités matériels. 6. **Business conduct** : Exigences G1-1 à G1-5, couvrant la culture d'entreprise, la gestion des relations avec les fournisseurs, la prévention et détection de la corruption, les incidents confirmés de corruption, et les activités d'influence politique et de lobbying. Chaque catégorie est associée à des sous-sections spécifiques, mettant en avant les politiques, objectifs, actions, et processus pertinents. and

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les exigences de divulgation liées à différents aspects de la durabilité, classées par matière de durabilité, section et sous-section. Les principales catégories incluent les travailleurs dans la chaîne de valeur, les communautés affectées, les consommateurs et utilisateurs finaux, la stratégie et gouvernance de durabilité, la matérialité, et la conduite des affaires. Chaque catégorie est associée à des sous-sections spécifiques, telles que les politiques, les objectifs, les actions, les processus pour soulever des préoccupations, et les modèles stratégiques. Les informations couvrent des sujets variés, allant de la gestion des relations avec les fournisseurs à la prévention de la corruption et des activités de lobbying.

  • Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau détaille les "exigences de divulgation et points de données associés", leur "matérialité" (matériel ou non matériel), et les "sous-sections/sous-sous-sections" correspondantes. Les points matériels incluent : 1. **ESRS E4-2** : Politiques sur les océans/mer et la déforestation, liées à la biodiversité et aux écosystèmes. 2. **ESRS E5-5** : Déchets non recyclés et dangereux, liés à l'économie circulaire et à l'utilisation des ressources. 3. **ESRS S1-1** : Engagements en matière de droits humains, politiques de diligence raisonnable, prévention des accidents, et mécanismes de gestion des plaintes, liés à la main-d'œuvre propre. 4. **ESRS S1-14** : Santé et sécurité, incluant les accidents et jours perdus. 5. **ESRS S1-16** : Écarts de rémunération entre genres et ratios de rémunération. 6. **ESRS S1-17** : Incidents de discrimination et non-respect des principes directeurs de l'ONU et des lignes directrices de l'OCDE, liés aux droits humains dans la main-d'œuvre propre. 7. **ESRS 2-SBM-3 - S2** : Risques significatifs de travail des enfants ou forcé dans la chaîne de valeur. 8. **ESRS S2-1** : Engagements en matière de droits humains pour les travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur. Les points non matériels incluent les risques d'incidents de travail forcé ou des enfants (ESRS 2-SBM-3 - S1) et les mesures contre la traite humaine (ESRS S1-1). and

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les exigences de divulgation et les points de données associés, leur matérialité (matériel ou non matériel), ainsi que les sous-sections ou sous-sous-sections correspondantes. Les points de données matériels concernent principalement les politiques liées à la biodiversité, l'économie circulaire, la sécurité au travail, les droits humains, les mécanismes de gestion des plaintes, et les écarts de rémunération. Les points non matériels sont considérés comme non applicables.

  • Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les exigences de divulgation et les points de données associés, classés par leur matérialité ("matériel", "non matériel" ou "non pertinent") et leurs sous-sections ou sous-sous-sections. Les exigences matérielles incluent : 1. **ESRS S2-1** : Non-respect des principes des UNGPs et des lignes directrices de l'OCDE (paragraphe 19) et politiques de diligence raisonnable liées aux conventions fondamentales de l'OIT (1 à 8, paragraphe 19), dans les sous-sections "politiques Allianz ESRS" et "stratégie et modèle d'affaires liés aux travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur". 2. **ESRS S2-4** : Questions et incidents relatifs aux droits humains dans la chaîne de valeur (paragraphe 36), avec des cibles, actions et processus pour remédier aux impacts négatifs. 3. **ESRS S3-1** : Engagements politiques en matière de droits humains (paragraphe 16) et non-respect des principes des UNGPs, de l'OIT ou de l'OCDE (paragraphe 17), dans le cadre de la stratégie et du modèle d'affaires liés aux communautés affectées. 4. **ESRS S3-4** : Questions et incidents relatifs aux droits humains (paragraphe 36), avec des actions et processus d'engagement avec les communautés affectées. 5. **ESRS S4-4** : Questions et incidents relatifs aux droits humains (paragraphe 35), avec des actions. 6. **ESRS G1-4** : Incidents confirmés de corruption ou de pots-de-vin (paragraphes 24 (a) et (b)). Les points non matériels ou non pertinents incluent : - **ESRS S4-1** : Politiques liées aux consommateurs et utilisateurs finaux (paragraphes 16 et 17), jugées non applicables. - **ESRS G1-1** : Convention des Nations Unies contre la corruption (paragraphe 10 (b)) et protection des lanceurs d'alerte (paragraphe 10 (d)), avec des politiques déjà en place. and

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les exigences de divulgation liées à divers aspects des droits humains, de la corruption et des politiques de diligence raisonnable. Il indique si ces exigences sont considérées comme "matérielles", "non matérielles" ou "non pertinentes", et précise les sous-sections ou sous-sous-sections associées. Les points matériels incluent des politiques et des actions liées aux droits humains, aux travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur, aux communautés affectées, ainsi qu'aux incidents confirmés de corruption ou de pots-de-vin. Les points non matériels ou non pertinents concernent principalement les politiques déjà en place ou les aspects jugés non applicables.

  • Le tableau présente deux catégories d'activités : **activités liées à l'énergie nucléaire** et **activités liées au gaz fossile**, avec une colonne "YES/NO" indiquant si l'entreprise mène, finance ou est exposée à ces activités. Pour les **activités nucléaires** : 1. Les activités de recherche, développement, démonstration et déploiement d'installations innovantes produisant de l'énergie nucléaire avec des déchets minimaux sont marquées "NO". 2. Les activités de construction et d'exploitation sécurisée de nouvelles installations nucléaires pour produire de l'électricité ou de la chaleur, y compris pour le chauffage urbain ou des processus industriels comme la production d'hydrogène, sont marquées "YES". 3. Les activités d'exploitation sécurisée des installations nucléaires existantes pour produire de l'électricité ou de la chaleur, y compris pour le chauffage urbain ou des processus industriels comme la production d'hydrogène, sont également marquées "YES". Pour les **activités liées au gaz fossile** : 4. La construction ou l'exploitation d'installations de production d'électricité utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles est marquée "YES". 5. La construction, rénovation et exploitation d'installations de cogénération de chaleur/refroidissement et d'électricité utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles sont marquées "YES". 6. La construction, rénovation et exploitation d'installations de production de chaleur/refroidissement utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles sont également marquées "YES". and

    BEGIN TABLE

    Row Nuclear energy related activities YES/NO
    1 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to research, development, demonstration and deployment of innovative electricity generation facilities that produce energy from nuclear processes with minimal waste from the fuel cycle. NO
    2 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to construction and safe operation of new nuclear installations to produce electricity or process heat, including for the purposes of district heating or industrial processes such as hydrogen production, as well as their safety upgrades, using best available technologies. YES
    3 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to safe operation of existing nuclear installations that produce electricity or process heat, including for the purposes of district heating or industrial processes such as hydrogen production from nuclear energy, as well as their safety upgrades. YES
    ----- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------
    Row Fossil gas related activities YES/NO
    4 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to construction or operation of electricity generation facilities that produce electricity using fossil gaseous fuels. YES
    5 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to construction, refurbishment, and operation of combined heat/cool and power generation facilities using fossil gaseous fuels. YES
    6 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to construction, refurbishment and operation of heat generation facilities that produce heat/cool using fossil gaseous fuels. YES

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente deux catégories d'activités : celles liées à l'énergie nucléaire et celles liées au gaz fossile. Pour les activités nucléaires, seules les activités de construction et d'exploitation sécurisée des installations nucléaires, qu'elles soient nouvelles ou existantes, sont marquées comme "YES". Les activités de recherche et développement pour des installations innovantes produisant de l'énergie nucléaire avec des déchets minimaux sont marquées "NO". En ce qui concerne les activités liées au gaz fossile, toutes les activités mentionnées, qu'il s'agisse de la construction, de la rénovation ou de l'exploitation d'installations de production d'électricité, de chaleur ou de refroidissement utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles, sont marquées "YES".

  • Résumé du contenu du tableau : - Le tableau détaille les leviers de décarbonation, les actions associées et les réductions des émissions de gaz à effet de serre (GHG) réalisées ou attendues pour les périodes du 1er janvier 2024 au 31 décembre 2024 et du 1er janvier 2025 au 31 décembre 2029. - Les réductions des émissions par rapport à la ligne de base au début de la période sont de (16.6) en 2024 et de (11.7) en 2025-2029. - Pour les clients assurés, l'engagement vers une transition net zéro est non quantifiable, tandis que la décarbonation des clients contribue à une réduction de 0.7 en 2024 et entre (13.5) et (7.5) en 2025-2029. - Les actions de pilotage du portefeuille commercial incluent : - Les solutions bas carbone, avec des réductions de (0.1) en 2024 et entre (5.4) et (3.4) en 2025-2029. - Les restrictions, avec des réductions de (0.2) en 2024 et entre (7.3) et (5.3) en 2025-2029. - Les changements supplémentaires dans le portefeuille, avec des réductions de 4.4 en 2024 et entre (13.0) et (11.0) en 2025-2029. - À la fin de la période, les réductions totales des émissions par rapport à la ligne de base sont de (11.7) en 2024 et de (45) en 2025-2029. and

    BEGIN TABLE

    Decarbonization levers Actions Achieved GHG emissions reduction 1.1.2024-31.12.2024 Expected GHG emissions reduction 1.1.2025-31.12.2029
    Start of period versus baseline (16.6) (11.7)
    Commercial – Insured customers decarbonization Engagement on net-zero transition Not quantifiable Not quantifiable
    Customer decarbonization 0.7 (13.5) to (7.5)
    Commercial – Portfolio steering Low-carbon solutions (0.1) (5.4) to (3.4)
    Restrictions (0.2) (7.3) to (5.3)
    Further portfolio changes 4.4 (13.0) to (11.0)
    End of period versus baseline (11.7) (45)

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : - Le tableau présente les leviers de décarbonation, les actions associées et les réductions des émissions de gaz à effet de serre (GHG) réalisées ou attendues sur deux périodes : 2024 et 2025-2029. - Au début de la période, les réductions des émissions par rapport à la ligne de base sont de (16.6) pour 2024 et (11.7) pour 2025-2029. - Les actions liées à la décarbonation des clients assurés incluent l'engagement vers une transition net zéro (non quantifiable) et la décarbonation des clients, qui contribue à une réduction de 0.7 en 2024 et entre (13.5) et (7.5) en 2025-2029. - Les actions de pilotage du portefeuille commercial incluent des solutions bas carbone ((0.1) en 2024 et entre (5.4) et (3.4) en 2025-2029), des restrictions ((0.2) en 2024 et entre (7.3) et (5.3) en 2025-2029), et des changements supplémentaires dans le portefeuille (4.4 en 2024 et entre (13.0) et (11.0) en 2025-2029). - À la fin de la période, les réductions totales des émissions par rapport à la ligne de base sont de (11.7) pour 2024 et (45) pour 2025-2029.

Oui, il existe une politique ou un système de prévention des accidents au travail. Selon le contexte fourni, Allianz a mis en place des systèmes de gestion de la santé et de la sécurité au travail (OHS) qui incluent des évaluations des risques de santé et de sécurité, des plans d'action dédiés pour atténuer ces risques, et des protocoles pour des actions d'urgence. De plus, le contexte mentionne que les accidents de travail et les systèmes de gestion de la prévention des accidents sont considérés comme des éléments matériels de leurs politiques liées à leur propre personnel.


Afficher les sourcesLLM
Sources LLM2 :
  • - Action plans are defined to address medium and high risks, incl. process tracking. There are processes in place to ensure monitoring of these components across the Allianz Group, which are outlined in more detail in the section Human rights in own workforce. Moreover, most Allianz subsidiaries have implemented local OHS management systems to effectively address OHS matters. These systems include OHS risk and hazard assessments, dedicated action plans to mitigate these risks, and protocols for emergency actions. Internal inspections are conducted and progress in reducing and preventing health issues and risks is evaluated against set targets. This encompasses procedures for investigating work-related injuries, ill health, diseases, and incidents, and regular workforce training to enhance awareness and reduce operational health and safety incidents. - Action plans are defined to address medium and high risks, incl. process tracking. There are processes in place to ensure monitoring of these components across the Allianz Group, which are outlined in more detail in the section Human rights in own workforce. Moreover, most Allianz subsidiaries have implemented local OHS management systems to effectively address OHS matters. These systems include OHS risk and hazard assessments, dedicated action plans to mitigate these risks, and protocols for emergency actions. Internal inspections are conducted and progress in reducing and preventing health issues and risks is evaluated against set targets. This encompasses procedures for investigating work-related injuries, ill health, diseases, and incidents, and regular workforce training to enhance awareness and reduce operational health and safety incidents.
  • ## Health and safety The health, safety, and physical and mental well-being of our employees is a fundamental aspect of our People and Culture strategy (see section Group People and Culture strategy – Related impacts, risks, and opportunities). We aim to maintain and enhance employee health and well-being throughout our global workforce. Two key levers to achieve this ambition are our Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) Management system, outlined in the ASPC and the Allianz Functional Rule for Human Rights Due Diligence in Own Operations, and our four Minimum Health Requirements. Our global Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) Management system, established in 2024, is built along the following components for applicable subsidiaries: - Dedicated GCSA Risk Experts, responsible for OHS are identified. - Health & Safety risk assessments are conducted at least annually, covering physical safety, workplace safety, and mental health. ## Health and safety The health, safety, and physical and mental well-being of our employees is a fundamental aspect of our People and Culture strategy (see section Group People and Culture strategy – Related impacts, risks, and opportunities). We aim to maintain and enhance employee health and well-being throughout our global workforce. Two key levers to achieve this ambition are our Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) Management system, outlined in the ASPC and the Allianz Functional Rule for Human Rights Due Diligence in Own Operations, and our four Minimum Health Requirements. Our global Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) Management system, established in 2024, is built along the following components for applicable subsidiaries: - Dedicated GCSA Risk Experts, responsible for OHS are identified. - Health & Safety risk assessments are conducted at least annually, covering physical safety, workplace safety, and mental health.

  • The four Minimum Health Requirements are reinforced by the “Agreement on Guidelines concerning Work-Related Stress and Minimum Health Requirements” between the Allianz SE and the (European) SE Works Council of Allianz SE. This agreement is applicable to Allianz SE and its subsidiaries with registered offices in the EU Member States, the EEA contracting states, the UK, and Switzerland. Allianz is committed to implementing these minimum health requirements throughout the Allianz Group, provided it does not contravene any national legislation. Adherence to these requirements is regularly monitored. The health and safety of our global workforce is measured via the following indicators: - WWiE, see section Engaging with own workforce. - Pulse surveys, see section Engaging with own workforce. - The KPIs of table S1-14 which are reviewed annually. - KPIs on Employee Assistance Programs which are regularly monitored and reported to the Allianz SE Board of Management. The four Minimum Health Requirements are reinforced by the “Agreement on Guidelines concerning Work-Related Stress and Minimum Health Requirements” between the Allianz SE and the (European) SE Works Council of Allianz SE. This agreement is applicable to Allianz SE and its subsidiaries with registered offices in the EU Member States, the EEA contracting states, the UK, and Switzerland. Allianz is committed to implementing these minimum health requirements throughout the Allianz Group, provided it does not contravene any national legislation. Adherence to these requirements is regularly monitored. The health and safety of our global workforce is measured via the following indicators: - WWiE, see section Engaging with own workforce. - Pulse surveys, see section Engaging with own workforce. - The KPIs of table S1-14 which are reviewed annually. - KPIs on Employee Assistance Programs which are regularly monitored and reported to the Allianz SE Board of Management.
  • For commercial insurance and non-listed proprietary investments, risk assessments and mitigating actions are governed by the *ASIS*, while those for our listed proprietary investments are governed by the *FRSI*, as described above. For the supply chain, risk assessments and mitigating actions are governed by the *Allianz Group Standard for Procurement*. We track the effectiveness of our actions and processes through the Corporate Rules Book process as described in the sections *Policies related to workers in the value chain* and *Integrating sustainability via corporate rules and other ESG policies*. Additionally, the Allianz Group Human Rights Officer monitors the effectiveness of our risk management system for the human rights of workers in our supply chain and reports to the Allianz SE Board of Management at least once a year. For commercial insurance and non-listed proprietary investments, risk assessments and mitigating actions are governed by the *ASIS*, while those for our listed proprietary investments are governed by the *FRSI*, as described above. For the supply chain, risk assessments and mitigating actions are governed by the *Allianz Group Standard for Procurement*. We track the effectiveness of our actions and processes through the Corporate Rules Book process as described in the sections *Policies related to workers in the value chain* and *Integrating sustainability via corporate rules and other ESG policies*. Additionally, the Allianz Group Human Rights Officer monitors the effectiveness of our risk management system for the human rights of workers in our supply chain and reports to the Allianz SE Board of Management at least once a year.
  • # Social Protection and Health and Safety This section includes the disclosures relevant to the topics of "Work-life balance", "Social protection", and “Health and safety” as covered by the ESRS S1 Own Workforce sustainability matter “Overall working conditions”. # Social Protection and Health and Safety This section includes the disclosures relevant to the topics of "Work-life balance", "Social protection", and “Health and safety” as covered by the ESRS S1 Own Workforce sustainability matter “Overall working conditions”.
  • From the material sustainability matters under S2, namely, “Working conditions”, “Equal treatment and opportunities for all”, and “Other work-related rights”, ASIS explores “Working conditions” and “Other work-related rights” through screening and searching for negative information about adequate wages, freedom of association or collective bargaining, child labor, forced labor, and health and safety. Regarding the protection of the human rights of people working for our tied agents, Allianz does not have standardized Group-wide policies to manage agents and other distribution channels. Instead, we rely on local policies, which are tailored to the unique conditions and regulatory environments of each country or region. From the material sustainability matters under S2, namely, “Working conditions”, “Equal treatment and opportunities for all”, and “Other work-related rights”, ASIS explores “Working conditions” and “Other work-related rights” through screening and searching for negative information about adequate wages, freedom of association or collective bargaining, child labor, forced labor, and health and safety. Regarding the protection of the human rights of people working for our tied agents, Allianz does not have standardized Group-wide policies to manage agents and other distribution channels. Instead, we rely on local policies, which are tailored to the unique conditions and regulatory environments of each country or region.
  • ## Determination of (retro-)ceded premium share For natural catastrophe events, Allianz Group subsidiaries transfer a portion of their business and associated risks to Allianz SE Reinsurance through internal reinsurance agreements. Allianz SE Reinsurance pools this business and, along with the net retained business of these local entities, manages the risk using external reinsurance purchased centrally on behalf of Allianz SE. 115 --- --- #### The underwriting KPI for non-life insurance and reinsurance undertakings ### BEGIN TABLE | Economic activities | Substantial contribution to climate change adaptation | DNSH (Do Not Significant Harm) | |-------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------| | | Absolute premiums 2024 (c mn) | Proportion of premiums 2024 (%) | Proportion of premiums 2023 (%) | Climate change mitigation (Y/N) | Water and marine resources (Y/N) | Circular economy (Y/N) | Pollution (Y/N) | Biodiversity and ecosystems (Y/N) | Minimum safeguards (Y/N) | | A.1.   • ### END TABLE [^1]: Unit-linked describes a type of investment, usually offered by a life insurance company, which is essentially a combination of insurance and an investment vehicle. ### END TABLE [^1]: Unit-linked describes a type of investment, usually offered by a life insurance company, which is essentially a combination of insurance and an investment vehicle.

Oui, Allianz a mis en place un système de gestion de la santé et de la sécurité au travail (OHS) pour prévenir les accidents au travail. Ce système comprend des évaluations des risques pour la santé et la sécurité, des plans d'action pour atténuer ces risques, et des protocoles pour les actions d'urgence. Des inspections internes sont également effectuées pour suivre les progrès dans la réduction et la prévention des problèmes de santé. De plus, les employés ont accès à des programmes d'assistance pour renforcer leur bien-être mental et physique.


Afficher les sources Pypdf
Sources Pypdf :
  • - Action plans are defined to address medium and high risks, incl. process tracking. There are processes in place to ensure monitoring of these components across the Allianz Group, which are outlined in more detail in the section Human rights in own workforce. Moreover, most Allianz subsidiaries have implemented local OHS management systems to effectively address OHS matters. These systems include OHS risk and hazards assessments, dedicated action plans to mitigate these risks, and protocols for emergency actions. Internal inspections are conducted and progress in reducing and preventing health issues and risks is evaluated against set targets. This encompasses procedures for investigating work-related injuries, ill health, diseases, and incidents, and regular workforce training to enhance awareness and reduce operational health and safety incidents.
  • ### Health and safety The health, safety, and physical and mental well-being of our employees is a fundamental aspect of our People and Culture strategy (see section Group People and Culture strategy - Related impacts. risks, and opportunities). We aim to maintain and enhance employee health and well-being throughout our global workforce. Two key levers to achieve this ambition are our Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) Management system, outlined in the ASPC and the Allianz Functional Rule for Human Rights Due Diligence in Own Operations, and our four Minimum Health Requirements. Our global Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) Management system, established in 2024, is built along the following components for applicable subsidiaries: - Dedicated GSCA Risk Experts, responsible for OHS are identified. - Health & Safety risk assessments are conducted at least annually, covering physical safety, workplace safety, and mental health.
  • The four Minimum Health Requirements are reinforced by the "Agreement on Guidelines concerning Work-Related Stress and Minimum Health Requirements" between the Allianz SE and the (European) SE Works Council of Allianz SE. This agreement is applicable to Allianz SE and its subsidiaries with registered offices in the E.U. Member States, the EEA contracting states, the U.K., and Switzerland. Allianz is committed to implementing these minimum health requirements throughout the Allianz Group, provided it does not contravene any national legislation. Adherence to these requirements is regularly monitored. The health and safety of our global workforce is measured via the following indicators: - WWI+, see section Engaging with own workforce. - Pulse surveys, see section Engaging with own workforce. - The KPIs of table S1-14 which are reviewed annually. - KPIs on Employee Assistance Programs which are regularly monitored and reported to the Allianz SE Board of Management.
  • ### Summary of the Table: The table provides data on health and safety metrics for employees and other workers, comparing the years 2024 and 2023. It includes the following labels, columns, and rows: 1. **Employees in own workforce covered by health and safety management system**: In 2024, 96.9% of employees were covered, while data for 2023 is not available (n.a.). 2. **Number of fatalities of employees related to work-related injuries/ill health**: There were no fatalities in 2024, compared to 1 in 2023. 3. **Number of fatalities of other workers on site related to work-related injuries/ill health**: No fatalities were reported in 2024, and data for 2023 is not available (n.a.). 4. **Number of recordable work-related accidents of employees**: 728 accidents occurred in 2024, compared to 847 in 2023. 5. **Rate of recordable work-related accidents of employees**: The rate was 3.3 per one million work hours in 2024, compared to 3.7 in 2023. 6. **Cases of recordable work-related ill health of employees**: 274 cases were reported in 2024, while 534 cases were re-stated for 2023 due to expanded reporting scope. 7. **Number of days lost to work-related fatalities/accidents/ill health of employees**: 21,251 days were lost in 2024, while 20,292 days were re-stated for 2023 due to expanded reporting scope.
  • ### Social protection and health and safety This section includes the disclosures relevant to the topics of "Work-life balance", "Social protection", and "Health and safety" as covered by the ESRS S1 Own Workforce sustainability matter "Overall working conditions".
  • For commercial insurance and non-listed proprietary investments, risk assessments and mitigating actions are governed by the ASIS, while those for our listed proprietary investments are governed by the FRSI, as described above. For the supply chain, risk assessments and mitigating actions are governed by the Allianz Group Standard for Procurement. We track the effectiveness of our actions and processes through the Corporate Rules Book process as described in the sections Policies related to workers in the value chain and Integrating sustainability via corporate rules and other ESRS policies. Additionally, the Allianz Group Human Rights Officer monitors the effectiveness of our risk management system for the human rights of workers in our supply chain and reports to the Allianz SE Board of Management at least once a year.
  • ### Policies related to workers in the value chain At Allianz, we address the management of material impacts on value chain workers through targeted due diligence processes with our business partners. An integral part of our due diligence processes across the value chain is due diligence on forced labor and child labor. In the event of identifying risks and issues, we may initiate engagement or make the decision not to collaborate with these business partners. These processes and actions are governed by different policies, depending on the specific value chain component. For our human rights commitment across the value chain, please refer to our Human Rights Policy Statement.
  • From the material sustainability matters under S2, namely, "Working conditions", "Equal treatment and opportunities for all", and "Other work-related rights", ASIS explores "Working conditions" and "Other work-related rights" through screening and searching for negative information about adequate wages, freedom of association or collective bargaining, child labor, forced labor, and health and safety. Regarding the protection of the human rights of people working for our tied agents, Allianz does not have standardized Group-wide policies to manage agents and other distribution channels. Instead, we rely on local policies, which are tailored to the unique conditions and regulatory environments of each country or region.

Los años no están especificados en el contenido. 1. **ESRS S2-1** aborda el incumplimiento de los principios de los UNGPs sobre Empresas y Derechos Humanos y las directrices de la OCDE (párrafo 19), así como las políticas de diligencia debida relacionadas con los convenios fundamentales de la OIT (párrafo 19). Ambos son materiales y se relacionan con las políticas de ESRS y el modelo de negocio estratégico para los trabajadores en la cadena de valor. 2. **ESRS S2-4** trata temas de derechos humanos e incidentes en la cadena de valor (párrafo 36), considerado material, con enfoque en objetivos, acciones, canales para plantear preocupaciones y procesos para remediar impactos negativos. 3. **ESRS S3-1** incluye compromisos de políticas de derechos humanos (párrafo 16) y el incumplimiento de principios de UNGPs, OIT u OCDE (párrafo 17), ambos materiales y vinculados al modelo de negocio estratégico para comunidades afectadas. 4. **ESRS S3-4** aborda temas e incidentes de derechos humanos (párrafo 36), considerado material, con enfoque en objetivos, acciones, canales para plantear preocupaciones y procesos de interacción con comunidades afectadas. 5. **ESRS S4-1** sobre políticas relacionadas con consumidores y usuarios finales (párrafo 16) y el incumplimiento de principios de UNGPs y OCDE (párrafo 17) no son materiales. 6. **ESRS S4-4** aborda temas e incidentes de derechos humanos (párrafo 35), considerado material, con enfoque en acciones. 7. **ESRS G1-1** sobre la Convención de las Naciones Unidas contra la Corrupción (párrafo 10 (b)) y la protección de denunciantes (párrafo 10 (d)) no son relevantes, ya que las políticas ya están implementadas. 8. **ESRS G1-4** sobre multas por violación de leyes anticorrupción y antirrobo (párrafo 24 (a)) y estándares anticorrupción y antirrobo (párrafo 24 (b)) son materiales, con enfoque en incidentes confirmados de corrupción o soborno. 9. Se menciona la aplicación de la cláusula de salvaguarda según ESRS 2.5(e) en relación con §§ 289e y 315c HGB para la brecha salarial de género en S1-16, sin más detalles.
  • ### Resumen de la tabla: La tabla presenta datos relacionados con los KPI de Taxonomía para las inversiones del Grupo Allianz en el año 2024. Los encabezados incluyen "Additional, complementary disclosures: breakdown of denominator of the KPI" y "Monetary amounts (€ bn)". Los porcentajes y proporciones se desglosan de la siguiente manera: 1. El porcentaje de derivados respecto al total de activos cubiertos por el KPI es del 3.0%. 2. La proporción de exposiciones a empresas financieras y no financieras no sujetas a los Artículos 19a y 29a de la Directiva 2013/34/EU sobre el total de activos cubiertos por el KPI es del 29.2% para empresas no financieras y del 16.7% para empresas financieras. 3. La proporción de exposiciones a empresas financieras y no financieras de países fuera de la UE no sujetas a los Artículos 19a y 29a de la Directiva 2013/34/EU es del 22.8% para empresas no financieras y del 10.2% para empresas financieras. 4. La proporción de exposiciones a empresas sujetas a los Artículos 19a y 29a de la Directiva 2013/34/EU es del 9.9% para empresas no financieras y del 28.5% para empresas financieras. 5. La proporción de exposiciones a otros contrapartes y activos sobre el total de activos cubiertos por el KPI es del 12.6%. 6. La proporción de inversiones distintas de las mantenidas en contratos de seguros de vida donde el riesgo de inversión es asumido por los asegurados es del 81.4%. 7. El valor de las inversiones que financian actividades económicas no elegibles según la Taxonomía, en relación con el total de activos cubiertos por el KPI, es del 31.1% para el "Turnover" y del 30.5% para el "CAPEX". 8. El valor de las inversiones que financian actividades económicas elegibles según la Taxonomía, pero no alineadas, es del 17.8% para el "Turnover" y del 18.3% para el "CAPEX".

Oui, Allianz a mis en place un système de gestion de la santé et de la sécurité au travail (OHS) à l'échelle mondiale. Ce système comprend des évaluations des risques et des dangers liés à la santé et à la sécurité, des plans d'action dédiés pour atténuer ces risques, ainsi que des protocoles pour les actions d'urgence. Des inspections internes sont effectuées régulièrement pour évaluer les progrès dans la réduction et la prévention des problèmes de santé et des risques. De plus, la formation régulière de la main-d'œuvre est prévue pour améliorer la sensibilisation et réduire les incidents liés à la santé et à la sécurité opérationnelles.

  • The health and safety of our global workforce is measured via the following indicators: − WWI+, see section Engaging with own workforce . − Pulse surveys, see section Engaging with own workforce . − The KPIs of table S1-14 which are reviewed annually. − KPIs on Employee Assistance Programs which are regularly monitored and reported to the Allianz SE Board of Management.   • their health and well -being through global surveys, such as Pulse surveys. For further information, please refer to the section Engaging with own workforce . 4. Focus Time: Meeting -free calendar days have been introduced to allow most employees dedicated time to focus on their work. The four Minimum Health Requirements are reinforced by the “Agreement on Guidelines concerning Work -Related Stress and Minimum Health Requirements” between the Allianz SE and the (European) SE Works Council of Allianz SE. This agreement is applicable to Allianz SE and its subsidiarie s with registered offices in the E.U. Member States, the EEA contracting states, the U.K., and Switzerland. Allianz is committed to implementing these minimum health requirements throughout the Allianz Group , provided it does not contravene any national legislation. Adherence to these requirements is regularly monitored. The health and safety of our global workforce is measured via the following indicators: their health and well -being through global surveys, such as Pulse surveys. For further information, please refer to the section Engaging with own workforce . 4. This agreement is applicable to Allianz SE and its subsidiarie s with registered offices in the E.U. Member States, the EEA contracting states, the U.K., and Switzerland. Allianz is committed to implementing these minimum health requirements throughout the Allianz Group , provided it does not contravene any national legislation.   • and risks is evaluated against set targets. This encompasses procedures for investigating work -related injuries, ill health, diseases, and incidents, and regular workforce trainin g to enhance awareness and reduce operational health and safety incidents. To further support employee health and well -being, Allianz established the following four Minimum Health Requirements, as applicable, in 2021: 1. Professional Support: Allianz provides employees with free- of- charge, 24/7 access to professional psychological support through its Employee Assistance Programs. 2. Leadership Enablement: Allianz offers targeted health and well - being training for people leaders through initiatives like #lead and other programs, ensuring that managers are equipped with the knowledge to sustain employee health and well -being, and to enhance resilience within their t eams. 3. Employee Feedback: Employees can provide annual feedback on their health and well -being through global surveys, such as Pulse and risks is evaluated against set targets. This encompasses procedures for investigating work -related injuries, ill health, diseases, and incidents, and regular workforce trainin g to enhance awareness and reduce operational health and safety incidents. To further support employee health and well -being, Allianz established the following four Minimum Health Requirements, as applicable, in 2021: 1. Professional Support: Allianz provides employees with free- of- charge, 24/7 access to professional psychological support through its Employee Assistance Programs. 2. Leadership Enablement: Allianz offers targeted health and well - being training for people leaders through initiatives like #lead and other programs, ensuring that managers are equipped with the knowledge to sustain employee health and well -being, and to enhance resilience within their t eams. 3. Employee Feedback: Employees can provide annual feedback on their health and well -being through global surveys, such as Pulse
  • Allianz recognizes these risks and has implemented various mitigation actions and initiatives to address them; see section Policies related to workers in the value chain. Policies related to workers in the value chain At Allianz , we address the management of material impacts on value chain workers through targeted due diligence processes with our business partners. An integral part of our due diligence processes across the value chain is due diligence on forced labor and child labor. In the event of identifying risks and issue s, we may initiate engagement or make the decision not to collaborate with these business partners. These processes and actions are governed by different policies, depending on the specific value ch ain component. For our human rights commitment across the value chain, please refer to our Human Rights Policy Statement . Given the breadth and changing nature of our global underwriting and proprietary investment portfolios and our global Allianz recognizes these risks and has implemented various mitigation actions and initiatives to address them; see section Policies related to workers in the value chain. These processes and actions are governed by different policies, depending on the specific value ch ain component.   • through the Corporate Rules Book process as described in the section s Policies related to workers in the value chain and Integrating sustainability via corporate rules and other ESRS policies . Additionally, the Allianz Group Human Rights Officer monitors the effectiveness of our risk management system for the human rights of workers in our supply chain and reports to the Allianz SE Board of Management at least once a year. Allianz has not adopted specific metrics or targets for workers in our value chain, hence there is also no timeframe for targets. This approach is adequate given the nature of our value chain – with a vast, diverse, and changing portfolio of companies we insure and invest in, and a global supply chain with very limited human rights risk (and hence limited upside for target setting). We have established comprehensive policies to prevent human rights violations that allow us to respond effectively to concerns that have been identified. Taxonomy for proprietary investments For investments, the E.U. Taxonomy Regulation currently limits the scope of financial investments that can be considered as “Taxonomy - eligible” to exposures to undertakings that are obliged to publish non - financial information pursuant to Article 19a or 29 a of Directive 2013/34/EU. This means that, for Taxonomy reporting as an investor in other undertakings, the Allianz Group can only consider reported data of economic activities of investees in scope of the NFRD that are reinsurance activities 59.7 0.1 - Y Y Y Y Y Y A.1.2.1 Of which reinsured (retrocession) 3.3 - - Y Y Y Y Y Y A.2 Non -life insurance and reinsurance underwriting Taxonomy- eligible but not environmentally sustainable activities (not Taxonomy -aligned activities) 65,719.0 76.6 76.3 B.   • Allianz took the decision to de -scope third- party asset management from E.U. Taxonomy investment reporting, in line with current market practice and our interpretation of existing regulatory requirements for 2024 reporting. The main alignment KPIs for 2024 include alignment based on turnover and alignment based on CAPEX. For our financial investments, each KPI is determined using only reported data for the investee. If, for example, Allianz has an investment in a company with a turnover alignment of 10 % and the book value of the investment is 100, Allianz would report a turnover alignment balance of 10. If Allianz has covered assets of 200, then the final alignment share based on turnover would be 10/200, or 5 %. The total alignment based on turnover additionally includes alignment shares from Allianz ’s own investment real estate held for investment, retail mortgages and renewable investments. The total alignment KPI based on CAPEX is determined in the same way. Allianz took the decision to de -scope third- party asset management from E.U. Taxonomy investment reporting, in line with current market practice and our interpretation of existing regulatory requirements for 2024 reporting. The main alignment KPIs for 2024 include alignment based on turnover and alignment based on CAPEX. For our financial investments, each KPI is determined using only reported data for the investee. If, for example, Allianz has an investment in a company with a turnover alignment of 10 % and the book value of the investment is 100, Allianz would report a turnover alignment balance of 10. If Allianz has covered assets of 200, then the final alignment share based on turnover would be 10/200, or 5 %. The total alignment based on turnover additionally includes alignment shares from Allianz ’s own investment real estate held for investment, retail mortgages and renewable investments. The total alignment KPI based on CAPEX is determined in the same way.
S1-56

Est-ce qu'il y a une politique ou système de traitement des plaintes des salariés ?

nan

Oui, Allianz dispose d'un mécanisme officiel de traitement des plaintes pour les salariés, appelé "SpeakUp@Allianz". Ce mécanisme permet aux employés, ainsi qu'à d'autres parties prenantes, de signaler des préoccupations, y compris les risques et violations des droits humains. Le système inclut plusieurs canaux de communication tels que l'email, le courrier postal et un outil de reporting en ligne qui permet la création de boîtes aux lettres anonymes. Ce mécanisme est accessible dans tous les pays où Allianz opère et est disponible en plusieurs langues. Les experts en conformité d'Allianz responsables du traitement des rapports sont indépendants et respectent les règles de confidentialité.


Afficher les sourcesLLM
Sources LLM :
  • The Allianz Group has specific procedures in place to ensure that no retaliation measures such as (written) warnings, demotion, dismissal, exclusion from promotions/bonuses, or other disadvantageous reflecting our taken against whistleblowers, measures are commitment to enable a healthy SpeakUp culture within the company. Retaliation measures in any form are not accepted. Reported cases of potential misconduct are treated in strict confidentiality. In the anti- retaliation procedure, the Compliance and HR functions exchange information to the extent necessary to allow identifying any potential measures that could compromise the integrity or objectivity of the 146 G1 Business Conduct investigation procedure and jeopardize whistleblower safeguarding rules. The Allianz Group has specific procedures in place to ensure that no retaliation measures such as (written) warnings, demotion, dismissal, exclusion from promotions/bonuses, or other disadvantageous reflecting our taken against whistleblowers, measures are commitment to enable a healthy SpeakUp culture within the company. Retaliation measures in any form are not accepted. Reported cases of potential misconduct are treated in strict confidentiality. In the anti- retaliation procedure, the Compliance and HR functions exchange information to the extent necessary to allow identifying any potential measures that could compromise the integrity or objectivity of the 146 G1 Business Conduct investigation procedure and jeopardize whistleblower safeguarding rules.
  • An effective external complaint management process builds trust, maintains customer relationships, ensures long-term retention, and safeguards Allianz’s reputation. Subsidiaries must comply with laws, regulations, and corporate rules concerning complaints management. Each subsidiary must have a standardized process to handle complaints and ensure fair treatment of customers. Additionally, Allianz has engagement channels, such as SpeakUp@Allianz, that are open to all people, inside and outside Allianz, who feel that they have been impacted by Allianz’s business or by a business in the Allianz value chain. For more details, please refer to the section Corruption and bribery. An effective external complaint management process builds trust, maintains customer relationships, ensures long-term retention, and safeguards Allianz’s reputation. Subsidiaries must comply with laws, regulations, and corporate rules concerning complaints management. Each subsidiary must have a standardized process to handle complaints and ensure fair treatment of customers. Additionally, Allianz has engagement channels, such as SpeakUp@Allianz, that are open to all people, inside and outside Allianz, who feel that they have been impacted by Allianz’s business or by a business in the Allianz value chain. For more details, please refer to the section Corruption and bribery.
  • Le tableau présente des données sur les droits humains et la main-d'œuvre propre pour les années 2024 et 2023. Les colonnes incluent "Description", "Unité", "2024" et "2023". Les lignes sont : "Nombre de plaintes déposées par les employés via le mécanisme officiel de plaintes Allianz", "Nombre de plaintes déposées auprès des Points de Contact Nationaux pour les Entreprises Multinationales de l'OCDE", "Nombre d'incidents de discrimination, y compris le harcèlement", "Nombre d'incidents graves relatifs aux droits humains concernant la main-d'œuvre propre", et "Montant des amendes matérielles, pénalités et compensations pour incidents liés à la main-d'œuvre propre". En 2024, 388 plaintes ont été déposées via le mécanisme officiel de plaintes Allianz, et 31 incidents de discrimination, y compris le harcèlement, ont été signalés. Aucun incident grave relatif aux droits humains ou montant d'amendes n'a été enregistré pour cette année. Les données pour 2023 ne sont pas disponibles (n.a.). and

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente des données sur les plaintes, incidents et amendes liés aux droits humains et à la main-d'œuvre propre pour les années 2024 et 2023. En 2024, 388 plaintes ont été déposées via le mécanisme officiel de plaintes Allianz, et 31 incidents de discrimination, y compris le harcèlement, ont été signalés. Aucun incident grave relatif aux droits humains ou montant d'amendes n'a été enregistré pour cette année. Les données pour 2023 ne sont pas disponibles (n.a.).

  • We apply the following definition for human rights issues under ESRS: − A complaint is any expression of dissatisfaction about a person or group. Customer complaints that are not related to potential misconduct are excluded. For further information, please refer to the section Corruption and bribery. − An incident is a predicated and confirmed event or occurrence that is contrary to the rules as set out in Allianz´s internal rules and/or legal regulations. − A severe human rights incident/violation is defined as follows: 131 S1 Own Workforce − Every case of child labor. − Every case of forced labor and modern slavery, including human trafficking. − Every case of severe (sexual) harassment or other severe human rights violations. We apply the following definition for human rights issues under ESRS: − A complaint is any expression of dissatisfaction about a person or group. Customer complaints that are not related to potential misconduct are excluded. For further information, please refer to the section Corruption and bribery. − An incident is a predicated and confirmed event or occurrence that is contrary to the rules as set out in Allianz´s internal rules and/or legal regulations. − A severe human rights incident/violation is defined as follows: 131 S1 Own Workforce − Every case of child labor. − Every case of forced labor and modern slavery, including human trafficking. − Every case of severe (sexual) harassment or other severe human rights violations.
  • On the basis of our risk assessments, we have identified the following human rights as the most relevant for our own workforce in the context of our business model: equal treatment, adequate wages, freedom of association and collective bargaining, and occupational health and safety. For details on our policies, actions, and targets on these specific rights, please refer to the relevant sections of S1 Own workforce and the Allianz company website. Our official global complaints mechanism SpeakUp@Allianz gives our employees, and everyone else, the opportunity to raise concerns including risks to, and violations of, human rights. The complaints mechanism is widely promoted through the Allianz intranet and other channels, and it forms part of the global training on violation reporting under GCSA. For further information on the channel, please refer to the section Corruption and bribery.   • − The Allianz complaints mechanism consists of several channels, including email, postal letter, and an online reporting tool that allows the creation of anonymous mailboxes allowing the reporting person to communicate with the responsible compliance experts. The tool is available in all countries in which Allianz operates. The tool is available in German, English, and 19 additional languages. − The rules of procedure for the Allianz complaints mechanism have been published form. They contain clear and comprehensible information on the process of reporting, the communication between the compliance experts and the reporting person, as well as the investigation of incidents raised by the reporting person. − The Allianz complaints mechanism consists of several channels, including email, postal letter, and an online reporting tool that allows the creation of anonymous mailboxes allowing the reporting person to communicate with the responsible compliance experts. The tool is available in all countries in which Allianz operates. The tool is available in German, English, and 19 additional languages. − The rules of procedure for the Allianz complaints mechanism have been published form. They contain clear and comprehensible information on the process of reporting, the communication between the compliance experts and the reporting person, as well as the investigation of incidents raised by the reporting person.
  • While Allianz has not adopted a dedicated process to engage with value chain workers, human rights issues can be addressed through existing engagement channels. Everyone inside and outside Allianz can report issues related to the human rights of workers in our value chain through our independent complaints mechanism, SpeakUp@Allianz, which is further detailed in the section G1 Business conduct. In 2024, no severe human rights violations of value chain workers were reported through SpeakUp@Alllianz. 135 S2 Workers in the Value Chain Adverse media screenings of potentially high-risk suppliers did not produce any information on human rights violations in our supply chain in 2024. For our insurance and proprietary investment, the ASIS process is designed to prevent Allianz from insuring or investing in companies that cause severe human rights violations. We continuously monitor our portfolios to be able to address violations should they occur. We continuously monitor our portfolios to be able to address violations should they occur.
  • It is accessible to Allianz employees, to the employees of Allianz’s direct and indirect suppliers, and to anyone else who might be impacted by the economic activities of Allianz. It enables people to draw attention to human rights and environmental risks, as well as violations of human rights or environmental obligations, that have arisen as a result of the economic activities of Allianz or of direct or indirect suppliers. − The Allianz compliance experts responsible for handling the reports submitted through SpeakUp@Allianz are independent and observe confidentiality rules. − Allianz does not tolerate any reprisals or any disadvantages for reporting persons related to their complaint.   • Le tableau présente deux catégories d'activités : **activités liées à l'énergie nucléaire** et **activités liées au gaz fossile**, avec une colonne "YES/NO" indiquant si l'entreprise mène, finance ou est exposée à ces activités. Pour les **activités nucléaires** : 1. Les activités de recherche, développement, démonstration et déploiement d'installations innovantes produisant de l'énergie nucléaire avec des déchets minimaux sont marquées "NO". 2. Les activités de construction et d'exploitation sécurisée de nouvelles installations nucléaires pour produire de l'électricité ou de la chaleur, y compris pour le chauffage urbain ou des processus industriels comme la production d'hydrogène, sont marquées "YES". 3. Les activités d'exploitation sécurisée des installations nucléaires existantes pour produire de l'électricité ou de la chaleur, y compris pour le chauffage urbain ou des processus industriels comme la production d'hydrogène, sont également marquées "YES". Pour les **activités liées au gaz fossile** : 4. La construction ou l'exploitation d'installations de production d'électricité utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles est marquée "YES". 5. La construction, rénovation et exploitation d'installations de cogénération de chaleur/refroidissement et d'électricité utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles sont marquées "YES". 6. La construction, rénovation et exploitation d'installations de production de chaleur/refroidissement utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles sont également marquées "YES". and

    BEGIN TABLE

    Row Nuclear energy related activities YES/NO
    1 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to research, development, demonstration and deployment of innovative electricity generation facilities that produce energy from nuclear processes with minimal waste from the fuel cycle. NO
    2 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to construction and safe operation of new nuclear installations to produce electricity or process heat, including for the purposes of district heating or industrial processes such as hydrogen production, as well as their safety upgrades, using best available technologies. YES
    3 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to safe operation of existing nuclear installations that produce electricity or process heat, including for the purposes of district heating or industrial processes such as hydrogen production from nuclear energy, as well as their safety upgrades. YES
    ----- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------
    Row Fossil gas related activities YES/NO
    4 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to construction or operation of electricity generation facilities that produce electricity using fossil gaseous fuels. YES
    5 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to construction, refurbishment, and operation of combined heat/cool and power generation facilities using fossil gaseous fuels. YES
    6 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to construction, refurbishment and operation of heat generation facilities that produce heat/cool using fossil gaseous fuels. YES

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente deux catégories d'activités : celles liées à l'énergie nucléaire et celles liées au gaz fossile. Pour les activités nucléaires, seules les activités de construction et d'exploitation sécurisée des installations nucléaires, qu'elles soient nouvelles ou existantes, sont marquées comme "YES". Les activités de recherche et développement pour des installations innovantes produisant de l'énergie nucléaire avec des déchets minimaux sont marquées "NO". En ce qui concerne les activités liées au gaz fossile, toutes les activités mentionnées, qu'il s'agisse de la construction, de la rénovation ou de l'exploitation d'installations de production d'électricité, de chaleur ou de refroidissement utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles, sont marquées "YES".

  • Résumé du contenu du tableau : - En 2024, 96.9 % des employés sont couverts par un système de gestion de la santé et de la sécurité, contre une donnée non disponible pour 2023. - Aucun décès d'employés lié à des blessures ou maladies professionnelles n'est enregistré en 2024, contre un décès en 2023. - Aucun décès d'autres travailleurs sur site lié à des blessures ou maladies professionnelles n'est enregistré en 2024, avec une donnée non disponible pour 2023. - Le nombre d'accidents de travail enregistrables chez les employés diminue, passant de 847 en 2023 à 728 en 2024. - Le taux d'accidents de travail enregistrables par million d'heures de travail diminue également, passant de 3.7 en 2023 à 3.3 en 2024. - Les cas de maladies professionnelles enregistrables chez les employés diminuent significativement, passant de 534 en 2023 à 274 en 2024. - Le nombre de jours perdus en raison de décès, d'accidents ou de maladies professionnelles augmente légèrement, passant de 20,292 en 2023 à 21,251 en 2024. and

    Indicateur Unité 2024 2023
    Employees in own workforce covered by health and safety management system % 96.9 n.a.

    Cases of recordable work-related ill health of employees # 274 534
    Number of days lost to work-related fatalities/accidents/ill health of employees # 21,251 20,292

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : - En 2024, 96.9 % des employés sont couverts par un système de gestion de la santé et de la sécurité, contre une donnée non disponible pour 2023. - Aucun décès d'employés lié à des blessures ou maladies professionnelles n'est enregistré en 2024, contre un décès en 2023. - Aucun décès d'autres travailleurs sur site lié à des blessures ou maladies professionnelles n'est enregistré en 2024, avec une donnée non disponible pour 2023. - Le nombre d'accidents de travail enregistrables chez les employés diminue, passant de 847 en 2023 à 728 en 2024. - Le taux d'accidents de travail enregistrables par million d'heures de travail diminue également, passant de 3.7 en 2023 à 3.3 en 2024. - Les cas de maladies professionnelles enregistrables chez les employés diminuent significativement, passant de 534 en 2023 à 274 en 2024. - Le nombre de jours perdus en raison de décès, d'accidents ou de maladies professionnelles augmente légèrement, passant de 20,292 en 2023 à 21,251 en 2024.

  • Le tableau présente deux catégories d'activités : celles liées à l'énergie nucléaire et celles liées aux gaz fossiles. - **Pour les activités liées à l'énergie nucléaire** : - La recherche, le développement et le déploiement d'installations innovantes produisant de l'énergie avec des déchets minimaux ne sont pas réalisés (**NO**, ligne 1). - La construction et l'exploitation sécurisée de nouvelles installations nucléaires, y compris pour le chauffage urbain ou les processus industriels, sont réalisées (**YES**, ligne 2). - L'exploitation sécurisée des installations nucléaires existantes, y compris pour le chauffage urbain ou les processus industriels, est également réalisée (**YES**, ligne 3). - **Pour les activités liées aux gaz fossiles** : - La construction ou l'exploitation d'installations de production d'électricité utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles n'est pas réalisée (**NO**, ligne 4). - La construction, la rénovation et l'exploitation d'installations combinées de production de chaleur/froid et d'électricité utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles ne sont pas réalisées (**NO**, ligne 5). - La construction, la rénovation et l'exploitation d'installations de production de chaleur/froid utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles ne sont pas réalisées (**NO**, ligne 6). and

    BEGIN TABLE

    Row Nuclear energy related activities YES/NO
    1 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to research, development, demonstration and deployment of innovative electricity generation facilities that produce energy from nuclear processes with minimal waste from the fuel cycle. NO
    2 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to construction and safe operation of new nuclear installations to produce electricity or process heat, including for the purposes of district heating or industrial processes such as hydrogen production, as well as their safety upgrades, using best available technologies. YES
    3 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to safe operation of existing nuclear installations that produce electricity or process heat, including for the purposes of district heating or industrial processes such as hydrogen production from nuclear energy, as well as their safety upgrades. YES
    Row Fossil gas related activities YES/NO
    ----- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ --------
    4 The undertaking carries out, funds, or has exposures to construction or operation of electricity generation facilities that produce electricity using fossil gaseous fuels. NO
    5 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to construction, refurbishment, and operation of combined heat/cool and power generation facilities using fossil gaseous fuels. NO
    6 The undertaking carries out, funds or has exposures to construction, refurbishment and operation of heat generation facilities that produce heat/cool using fossil gaseous fuels. NO

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente deux catégories d'activités : celles liées à l'énergie nucléaire et celles liées aux gaz fossiles.
    - Pour les activités liées à l'énergie nucléaire : - La recherche, le développement et le déploiement d'installations innovantes produisant de l'énergie avec des déchets minimaux ne sont pas réalisés (NO). - La construction et l'exploitation sécurisée de nouvelles installations nucléaires, y compris pour le chauffage urbain ou les processus industriels, sont réalisées (YES). - L'exploitation sécurisée des installations nucléaires existantes, y compris pour le chauffage urbain ou les processus industriels, est également réalisée (YES).
    - Pour les activités liées aux gaz fossiles : - La construction ou l'exploitation d'installations de production d'électricité utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles n'est pas réalisée (NO). - La construction, la rénovation et l'exploitation d'installations combinées de production de chaleur/froid et d'électricité utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles ne sont pas réalisées (NO). - La construction, la rénovation et l'exploitation d'installations de production de chaleur/froid utilisant des combustibles gazeux fossiles ne sont pas réalisées (NO).

Oui, Allianz dispose d'un mécanisme formel de traitement des plaintes pour ses employés, appelé SpeakUp@Allianz. Ce mécanisme est accessible aux employés d'Allianz ainsi qu'aux employés de ses fournisseurs directs et indirects, et à toute autre personne pouvant être impactée par les activités économiques d'Allianz. Il permet de signaler des risques et des violations des droits de l'homme ou des obligations environnementales. Les experts en conformité qui gèrent les rapports soumis via SpeakUp@Allianz sont indépendants et respectent les règles de confidentialité. Allianz ne tolère aucune représailles ou désavantage pour les personnes rapportant des problèmes liés à leur plainte.


Afficher les sourcesLLM
Sources LLM2 :
  • The Allianz Group has specific procedures in place to ensure that no retaliation measures such as (written) warnings, demotion, dismissal, exclusion from promotions/bonuses, or other disadvantageous measures are taken against whistleblowers, reflecting our commitment to enable a healthy SpeakUp culture within the company. Retaliation measures in any form are not accepted. Reported cases of potential misconduct are treated in strict confidentiality. In the anti-retaliation procedure, the Compliance and HR functions exchange information to the extent necessary to allow identifying any potential measures that could compromise the integrity or objectivity of the investigation procedure and jeopardize whistleblower safeguarding rules. The Allianz Group has specific procedures in place to ensure that no retaliation measures such as (written) warnings, demotion, dismissal, exclusion from promotions/bonuses, or other disadvantageous measures are taken against whistleblowers, reflecting our commitment to enable a healthy SpeakUp culture within the company. Retaliation measures in any form are not accepted. Reported cases of potential misconduct are treated in strict confidentiality. In the anti-retaliation procedure, the Compliance and HR functions exchange information to the extent necessary to allow identifying any potential measures that could compromise the integrity or objectivity of the investigation procedure and jeopardize whistleblower safeguarding rules.
  • ### Under the headline SpeakUp@Allianz Our worldwide complaints mechanism has the following features: - It is accessible to Allianz employees, to the employees of Allianz's direct and indirect suppliers, and to anyone else who might be impacted by the economic activities of Allianz. - It enables people to draw attention to human rights and environmental risks, as well as violations of human rights or environmental obligations, that have arisen as a result of the economic activities of Allianz or of direct or indirect suppliers. - The Allianz compliance experts responsible for handling the reports submitted through SpeakUp@Allianz are independent and observe confidentiality rules. - Allianz does not tolerate any reprisals or any disadvantages for reporting persons related to their complaint. ### Under the headline SpeakUp@Allianz Our worldwide complaints mechanism has the following features: - It is accessible to Allianz employees, to the employees of Allianz's direct and indirect suppliers, and to anyone else who might be impacted by the economic activities of Allianz. - It enables people to draw attention to human rights and environmental risks, as well as violations of human rights or environmental obligations, that have arisen as a result of the economic activities of Allianz or of direct or indirect suppliers. - The Allianz compliance experts responsible for handling the reports submitted through SpeakUp@Allianz are independent and observe confidentiality rules. - Allianz does not tolerate any reprisals or any disadvantages for reporting persons related to their complaint.
  • # Processes and Actions Related to Own Workforce ## Processes and Channels to Raise Concerns For further information, please refer to the sections [Human rights in own workforce](#) and [Corruption and bribery](#). # Processes and Actions Related to Own Workforce ## Processes and Channels to Raise Concerns For further information, please refer to the sections [Human rights in own workforce](#) and [Corruption and bribery](#).
  • On the basis of our risk assessments, we have identified the following human rights as the most relevant for our own workforce in the context of our business model: equal treatment, adequate wages, freedom of association and collective bargaining, and occupational health and safety. For details on our policies, actions, and targets on these specific rights, please refer to the relevant sections of S1 Own workforce and the Allianz company website. Our official global complaints mechanism SpeakUp@Allianz gives our employees, and everyone else, the opportunity to raise concerns including risks to, and violations of, human rights. The complaints mechanism is widely promoted through the Allianz intranet and other channels, and it forms part of the global training on violation reporting under GCSA. For further information on the channel, please refer to the section Corruption and bribery. We apply the following definition for human rights issues under ESRS: On the basis of our risk assessments, we have identified the following human rights as the most relevant for our own workforce in the context of our business model: equal treatment, adequate wages, freedom of association and collective bargaining, and occupational health and safety.   • While Allianz has not adopted a dedicated process to engage with value chain workers, human rights issues can be addressed through existing engagement channels. Everyone inside and outside Allianz can report issues related to the human rights of workers in our value chain through our independent complaints mechanism, *SpeakUp@Allianz*, which is further detailed in the section *G.1 Business conduct*. In 2024, no severe human rights violations of value chain workers were reported through *SpeakUp@Allianz*. Adverse media screenings of potentially high-risk suppliers did not produce any information on human rights violations in our supply chain in 2024. For our insurance and proprietary investment, the *ASIS* process is designed to prevent Allianz from insuring or investing in companies that cause severe human rights violations. We continuously monitor our portfolios to be able to address violations should they occur. We continuously monitor our portfolios to be able to address violations should they occur.
  • - The Allianz complaints mechanism consists of several channels, including email, postal, later, and an online reporting tool that allows the creation of anonymous mailboxes allowing the reporting person to communicate with the responsible compliance experts. The tool is available in all countries in which Allianz operates. The tool is available in German, English, and 19 additional languages. - The rules of procedure for the Allianz complaints mechanism have been published in text form. They contain clear and comprehensible information on the process of reporting, the communication between the compliance experts and the reporting person, as well as the investigation of incidents raised by the reporting person. - The Allianz complaints mechanism consists of several channels, including email, postal, later, and an online reporting tool that allows the creation of anonymous mailboxes allowing the reporting person to communicate with the responsible compliance experts.   • Employees are encouraged to report concerns about any possible illegal or other misconduct that might violate the Allianz Group Code of Conduct, any laws, regulations, order of regulators, or any internal corporate rules. Employees have multiple channels for doing so. These include via management, speaking directly with Group Compliance, by e-mail, or anonymously via a third-party solution provided by EQS Group GmbH and accessible via the intranet. The same tool is also accessible to external parties on the Allianz company website.   • ## Determination of (retro-)ceded premium share For natural catastrophe events, Allianz Group subsidiaries transfer a portion of their business and associated risks to Allianz SE Reinsurance through internal reinsurance agreements. Allianz SE Reinsurance pools this business and, along with the net retained business of these local entities, manages the risk using external reinsurance purchased centrally on behalf of Allianz SE. 115 --- --- #### The underwriting KPI for non-life insurance and reinsurance undertakings ### BEGIN TABLE | Economic activities | Substantial contribution to climate change adaptation | DNSH (Do Not Significant Harm) | |-------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------| | | Absolute premiums 2024 (c mn) | Proportion of premiums 2024 (%) | Proportion of premiums 2023 (%) | Climate change mitigation (Y/N) | Water and marine resources (Y/N) | Circular economy (Y/N) | Pollution (Y/N) | Biodiversity and ecosystems (Y/N) | Minimum safeguards (Y/N) | | A.1.
